2. My skin: coconut oil moisturizes my skin very well. It is also a very good makeup remover. I use coconut oil on any dry spots on my skin, but I do not use it on my face. While many people have no problems using coconut oil as a facial moisturizer, it can be a problem for someone with acne prone skin.

3. Cooking: coconut oil is great for cooking. It adds a really great flavor to a bowl of oatmeal. I sometimes even add some into my coffee. I've made cookies and bars with coconut oil and have had great results.

I am now a confirmed addict of this stuff. If I run out, I start craving it. Popcorn is just not the same without melted coconut oil and sprinkling of coarse sea salt. Cannot be morre specific than to say that my body 'feels' better--joints, mobility, sense of well being since I started consumming it regularly. The scent of it is intoxicating as well. I for one don't need a scientific "paper" to tell me what my body needs and responds well to.

Summary: So tasty, so good for you!
Text:
It's rare to find a food that's both utterly delicious and, at the same time, fantastically good for you -- but this is one of those. Coconut oil isn't just a great, healthy fat, it's also a fat that adds a delicious coconut flavor to anything you cook with it. I was used to coconut as a sweet thing, but through working with this I've found that it goes wonderfully with a wide range of savory foods too.

I've no experience of any other brand of coconut oil, as this was the first one I tried. However, it's such good quality that I'd not consider trying another one now. Really excellent, and something to make sure you always have in your cupboard, especially if you're following a Paleo style of diet.

Great tasting organic Coconut Oil. I use this in a variety of my RAW dessert recipes, from cookies to pies to chocolate sauces and the like. Adding a tablespoon or two will give you that nice coconut flavor without taking away from the rest of what you have going on in the recipe. Great buy for the price!

Nutiva coconut oil is my favorite coconut oil. It has a subtle, but distinct coconut flavor that adds something to every dish. I use it in baking, cooking eggs, almost anything! Maybe next I will try making popcorn with it!
I use the coconut oil for almost all my baking now.  So far this is my favorite brand. With the two pack amazon made it a great deal.

When it comes to taste, texture and scent, this is not only by far but the best brand out there! This is made in the Philippines - one of the top three countries where coconuts are bountiful. Trust me! There are so many health beneficial you can get from coconut oil. Google it or read a book about Lauric Acid, which is the main source of the coconut oil. You will find other great health benefits of this product. As for me, I take 2 tablespoons everyday.

The price went up a little bit because the consumer demand is getting huge! But still Amazon has the cheapest price out there. You can compare the price to any herb/organic retail store. Ordering through Amazon will save you more.
Nutiva brand is wonderful!!  I want to take a bath in this stuff - it smells so yummy!  Since it's organic and unrefined, the flavor is amazing and very fresh.  Love this stuff for popping corn.

Summary: Love Nutiva coconut oil, but not digging the price hike.
Text: I love this product and the 15 oz tubs are perfect for use around the kitchen. The value was amazing, especially with the old subscribe and save pricing, HOWEVER, the price just jumped %25 for this 2 pack, which is disappointing... I'm cancelling my subscription and looking for another option, like the 29 oz 2 pack.

This is a very good organic coconut oil.  I think this one is the most selling coconut oil in the market right now.  I'd highly recommend this oil, but not Amazon for buying it.  It took them an entire week just to prepare the shipment, and they couldn't give me a good reason why they took so long.  I placed another order through via different website yesterday, and I've already received an e-mail today and indicated that I'll receive this shipment tomorrow!  This oil has a strong aroma, and I like it.  However, my husband hates it, and if you don't like the smell of coconut, I'd recommend Jarrow brand that is brown bottle.  It's also organic, but it's expeller pressed, so I heard it's almost odorless.  I'll also buy Jarrow in the future to use more widely in cooking.  I use Nutiva from head to toe, and I also use it to make scrambled eggs.  You can smell the oil in the food, so if you don't like the coconut smell, that'd be a problem.

Where has this stuff been all my life? I keep trying this for various things and it's helped with all of them so far.

A tiny bit on my face before bed. Now my face is soft.
Dry, calloused feet? A tiny bit rubbed on my feet then slept in socks. Now my feet are softer.
Ladies with "chafing issues" - coconut oil to the rescue.
I have not tried it on my hair yet.

My other jar is in the kitchen. It's great in coffee and gives scrambled eggs a whole new taste. I think it would be great on a waffle. That's next.
what more could be said than all the great reviews already posted??? i just wanted to jump on the bandwagon and add my 5 star rating as well.
I love Nutiva Organic Coconut Oil! I use it to make my popcorn. I use 3 tblsp. of oil and 1/2 cup of popcorn. Pop those together for a healthier choice snack! LOVE it!!

This high quality Virgin coconut oil will become the only thing you use in your skillet. NO cholesterol and natural healing properties.

In addition, it is great for hair and body moisturizing. Put one jar in the kitchen and the other in the bath.

Summary: Gives a Good Hint of Coconut to Food
Text:
Nutiva Extra Virgin Coconut Oil tastes so good in all the pan fried foods I've cooked so far. I've fried up char-siu fried rice, shrimp fried rice, scrambled eggs, and even made grilled cheese sandwiches using this oil. Everything comes out tasting great, with just a tiny hint of coconut aftertaste - not enough to overpower the dishes, but just enough for people to go "what was that extra seasoning you used? It's really good!".

The bottles pictured are not exactly the bottle you will receive - I got two smaller looking tubs of the coconut oil. There were no problems with shipping, but I did notice that on a 70 degree day that my bottle of oil went liquid, so I can see problems arising when shipping during summer. I haven't tried using this product on my skin or hair, but I can imagine it would smell nice - I love coconut! Highly recommended.

I live in a rural area so I have a limited amount of places to purchase organic groceries. This is an extraordinary deal when compared to the price I pay locally, especially when you use the subscribe and save feature! I had no issues with shipping.
I like the auto shipment order for this 15oz coconut oil tubs. However, the manufacturer recently discontinued this product.  It is a great healthy product.

Summary: Why are we no longer able to autoship my item?
Text: Hey, I really love this product! I just received the same message that they can't fulfill my order!!???? I have NO complaints about this product, and I expect it to be a bit messy in summer! (it is OIL!!!). Why is this product no longer available from the supplier? I am on auto ship so I can keep a consistent supply since I use it for EVERYTHING!!! Great product but questionable practice by Amazon to say the least.

Summary: Great Product & Amazon Service. Expect Greasy Delivery in Hot Weather.
Text:
The benefits of organic Coconut Oil are endless and this brand is wonderful. Another reviewer had warned about ordering cocounut oil in hot weather days. Coconut oil is liquid at room temperature, so it'll probably leak & evaporate from jar at 85*F+ (wildly guessing here).

If you look at the same item in FL store shelves, their jars are kinda greasy too especially in the spring/summer months.

I got my shipment today. Amazon did a superb job in packaging. And yet no matter how well packaged, the jars in bubble wrap, plastic bag & box, leaked the same.

Gotta expect the oil to leak from jar while in transit in hot weather and also be prepared to do some smart cleaning upon receipt. I suggest leaving jars in bubble wrap + bag. Place all on paper towels and put inside fridge for 1/2 hr. When oil is solid, remove wrappings. Rinse jars under warm water, use oil residue on hands, arms, face (never let a good crisis go to waste!) Inspect lids & seals. All should be intact, maybe just a tad oily. After rinsing & once product is partially solid, there should be NO leaking from anywhere. If so, then the jar must be cracked. Remove oil and place in another container -- a glass jar would be best.

The product is great and perhaps worth the hassle if ordering in hot days. Another option, would be to place orders in cooler months. No mess. No stress.

Summary: Delicious smelling body lotion and hair treatment
Text: I had been using Barleans organic coconut oil for cooking and as a body lotion and a conditioning treatment for my dry curly hair.  I decided to order the Nutiva brand because it was about half the price.  All in all I am pleased with  my purchase.  I slightly prefer the Barleans because I think it is smoother and has a fresher scent, the Nutiva smells more sweet and has a bit of a lingering smell. I have not used the Nutiva brand in cooking yet. But I love organic coconut oil and Nutiva has a great price on amazon.

I was searching for a lotion for my husband's psoriasis and the search engine brought up coconut oil! I thought that was unusual, but decided to start researching coconut oil and its uses. Wow! This natural oil has so many uses and is extremely healthy! It is anti-bacterial, anti-microbal, anti-viral, and anti-fungal.
I've been putting it on my husband's psoriasis for three days, but it hasn't been long enough to tell yet whether it will help; I'll keep you posted.
Awesome moisturizer--I've been using it for the last week as a body oil after I shower and everynight on my face before bed, and my skin is so smooth and soft! It soaks right in as long as you use it sparingly with no greasy feeling.
Natural deoderant--I found a homemade deoderant recipe on the internet today and will let you know in a later post how it works.
Toothpaste Booster--Since it has anti-bacterial properties, I have been using 1/2 and 1/2 of my usual toothpaste and coconut oil to brush my teeth! I know that sounds disgusting, but coconut oil does not feel oily in your mouth...honest!
I have been taking 1T morning (with my calcium pills because it's supposed to help your body absorb nutrients more efficiently), noon and night without changing what I eat and lost two pounds in a week! I was pleasantly surprised when I felt full for longer periods of time and was also eating less at each meal because I felt satisfied. Another plus was that I was no longer constantly snacking in the evenings, which has been my worst habit to break but now I don't even feel like snacking! Some people mentioned they
I found my dog loves licking my skin after putting on coconut oil, so I've been researching to find out if it's good for dogs. From what I've read so far, it is just as healthy for her, too!

Summary: Taste fantastic with just about anything and not strong...
Text:
This is the best-tasting oil on the market for 1 simple reason. Unlike my other fave, evoo, it is not strong in flavor and you can fry chicken with it or use it for "buttering" cheese toast and although the coconut smell is stronger, the taste is sort of mildly bland, barely there at times, if you use it sparingly.

What I absolutely love are the monounsaturated fat health benefits you derive every time you use this certified organic cold-pressed coconut oil.

I cannot believe how absolutely positively fantastic I feel. I wish I had thought to baste the organic Plainville farms turkey I got a few months back with this oil, I think it would have been a treat! There are so many yummy ways you can use this oil to bring out even more flavors from you food. My husband loved stir-fried KFC chicken breast and some frozen veggies together in lots of the coconut oil. And I stir-fried roast Asian duck, and crispy Asian pork with this oil and some frozen veggies.

It is versatile and although bland-tasting when used sparingly can add delicious and unique carribean or island flavor when you use it more generously.

I love this brand and I am hooked, line and sinker on this oil. I will be considering looking locally for their hemp and other products to compare with Amazon.com prices as well.

It's fabulous like others have said...
* It's 15oz by volume not weight so it's not too much (thought would be bigger..sad face!)
* Price is okay I purchased on Friday Sale and it was comparable to local store
* Some review said try in coffee - I tried in tea and wouldn't recommend this - creates oil field on top of drink
* Great as moisturizer
* Great with sauteed potatoes & caramelized onions, had pulled pork with eggs so it had a caribbean flare to it
* Excellent for cooking pancakes with - adds a richness to pancake, we add peanut butter to pancake and a bit of grade b pure maple syrup it's really decadent!

This is the best coconut oil I've tried so far! The flavor is amazing, the purity and texture is perfect! Not too bad on the price either, especially when shipped with FREE 2day shipping via Amazon Mom/Prime.

I use coconut oil for many many things, as my 2 year old is allergic to butter/milk etc. I use it as a butter, as an oil, a lotion, etc.

A++!

Love, love LOVE Nutiva EVCO.  Previously I had been using the 365 Brand which is an in-store brand provided by a health food store.  It was ok, but it had zero scent and was a bit lumpy.  This brand is SO much better, I love the scent of light coconut and the packaging is plastic which is great because its not super heavy like the glass jars I usually encounter (and the fact that I am a bit clumsy and could easily drop and shatter it).  Its super versatile for cooking, I give it to my dog and cats for their overall health and well-being, and I use it as a hair conditioner which is by far my favorite use for it (as a preshampoo or overnight conditioner).  HIGHLY recommended.

Summary: tastes great and great for higher heat cooking
Text: I love the taste of this oil. My wife hates the ways coconut smells and tastes, but when I cook with this she doesn't notice the coconut at all. It is too subtle for anything that is well seasoned. Also, this works much better with the high heat cooking I like to do when searing a meat or fish than any other oil I've used.

I don't know about the health benefits yet, I've only been using it for 3 weeks.  I like that a little goes a long way. There is a slight coconut undertaste that cooks away at higher temps.  I have a Presto Microwave popcorn popper and it works well with that. I also used some on my hair to see if it would stop the breakage I'm having due to medications but no change yet.  It has however made an improvement on my finger cuticles so maybe with time it would help my hair too. I say give it a try, you don't lose anything if you use it in place of another oil you were going to buy.

I started using this product in October and I now use it for all my cooking, as a spread on muffins or bread, on baked potatoes, etc as well as on my skin.  Being well aware of the benefits of coconut oil I find this product to be a great value.

Tried this brand - Nutiva coconut oil in my attempts to find a safe cooking oil - and this is so delicious. The flavor is strong because it is unrefined and eggs are heavenly fried lightly in it! Bought it from Amazon and got it very quickly and the bottles were safe and unbroken. !!
It was nicely packaged and arrived very quickly. This product is also very great, I use it in my everyday diet and beauty regime. I am a much healthier person now.

I use this on my hair and this (along with another moisturizer/oil) has made it feel so soft! And it has so many used I might use it when I cook but I'm not quite there yet. I'm not sure if the cost is right or not but I use a lot of the oil and I haven't even used 1/8th of the 1st tub yet. I'm very happy with it and will buy this & this brand again.

I received mine the other day and I love it! It came solid as a rock, It happened to arrive on a cold day. It has a wonderful scent but not overpowering. Disappears after a short time. I put it on my oatmeal with chia seeds and it's delicious! Will always keep some of this in my house. One jar in the bathroom and one in the kitchen.

great stuff!

I like this coconut oil.  The coconut flavor is mild, so I can cook most foods without flavors fighting for the spotlight.  I know people can eat this right out of the canister, but I truly just use it for cooking and occasionally as a moisturizer for my cuticles....

I'm trying to replace shortening and other oils in cooking with coconut oil for health reasons. I like the flavor and consistency of this brand, and like the smaller size tubs to keep it fresh longer.

I cook everything in coconut oil: vegetables, eggs, meat, fish...sometimes I eat it straight from the jar. Previously, my go-to coconut oil was manufactured by Spectrum, and for a time, I was pleased. I then found the Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil and have not turned back.

The aroma and flavor are real, raw, and extremely pleasurable. Open the jar and take a whiff; I guarantee that you have never smelled a coconut oil like this one.

Summary: Tastes like coconut, is delicious and healthy!
Text: I wanted to try coconut oil after hearing about the health benefits.  In the winter, you don't need to worry about it spilling in shipment because it is solid below 76 degrees F.  I don't actually like shredded coconut but I love the taste of this coconut oil (guess I don't like the texture of coconut!).  I've only used it once so far, and that was to cook a Mexican-style fajita mix with vegetables (onion, garlic, peppers, tomato, and chile) and black beans.  There was a hint of the coconut flavor in the finished product, but it tasted really good!  I am trying to figure out how to eat more of this oil, but I will definitely use it in place of olive oil for sauteeing vegetables.  It is safe for cooking up to 350 degrees.  It melts quickly.  This is good quality coconut oil for a great price!  I bought it here on Amazon because I wanted to try it and the price was much cheaper than elsewhere online.

Summary: I really enjoy it's clean fresh taste and light texture.
Text: Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil has become my favorite cooking oil since I discovered it about 2 years ago. I really enjoy it's clean fresh taste and light texture. I now only use real butter about 10% of the time for it's butter flavor and extra virgin olive less than 5% of the time in a few Italian dishes.  I no longer use shortening or margarine or other cooking oils for cooking or baking. I keep small amounts in fancy recycled jars in my bathrooms,bedrooms and purse to use instead of hand lotions or massage/body oils.  I love how it softens and protects my skin in Idaho's dry climate.

Summary: Great for kitchen and bath use!
Text:
I had never heard of using coconut oil for either cooking or body use. It wasn't until my massage therapist starting using it for massaging, that I became aware of it's many uses. I just rec'd. my second order and continue to find more and more uses.

I use it primarily for hair and skin. A small amount rubbed through my hair at night covered with a shower cap, and shampooed out in the morning leaves my hair soft and shiny. This works much better than chemically laden and costly hair products.

In place of commercial lotions, this leaves my dry skin soft and smooth. The coconut fragrance is light and dissipates quickly, so it doesn't interfere with any other fragrances you may use.

It has worked well with what little cooking I do! LOL Add a couple of spoonfuls to homemade smoothies.

As for cost...Amazon's price is exactly half of my local health food store, for the identical brand.

I do agree with many others regarding the packaging. A glass jar would be preferable. The plastic is too flimsy for the product.

I use this oil in cooking. I've made muffins, cake, pancakes using this instead of butter - all turned out excellent and the recipes didn't require any finagling. It does impart a coconutty scent to a dish though I don't think that the flavor itself is noticeable. I especially like using this for stir-fries. It holds up to heat well and gives an extra dimension to the many scents/flavors in asian dishes. It pairs really nicely with lots of chili and lime.

I also use the oil as a body moisturizer. It is absolutely wonderful for the skin after a shower. I've even used it on my hair. a little goes a long way but i like to smear it on when still in the shower and dry some of it off. Its also great for the lips throughout the day. My skin is very soft and the smell fades as you dry.

I love this package because I can put one tub in the kitchen and one in the bathroom.

I decided to purchase this coconut oil at the recommendation of various nutrition experts because of the medium chain fatty acids in coconut oil. I learned that coconut oil consists of predominately medium-chain fatty acids which digest more easily, are the kinds of fats in mother's milk, and are preferentially used by the liver as a source of fuel to produce energy.

Cooking can significantly affect many fats and oils causing the formation of toxic compounds. However, coconut oil is safe for cooking because it is the oil with the largest amount of saturated fatty acids and the least amount of polyunsaturated fatty acids. Ninety-two percent is saturated and only 1.5 percent is polyunsaturated. You can use coconut oil for cooking without having to worry about it harming your health. It is so stable you can reheat the oil and use it several times without damaging it. Not only does coconut not form harmful toxins when heated, but it also has many health benefits.

For more information on coconut oil benefits, I recommend Dr. Bruce Fife's books on the subject.

I love the taste of this oil and use it almost exclusively for cooking. I put it in our morning oatmeal for a wonderful coconut flavor and the added health benefits that it gives. I use it in most of my baked goods, as well.

This has been incredible as a moisturizer, I use it like butter on toast, and cooking with it gives everything an awesome flavor.  It's one of the best things in the world for you, and I make sure my son gets at least a spoonful of it a day.  Only difficulty I've had with it is that I just moved to a warmer climate, where it is 80 inside instead of 65 degrees Fahrenheit, so instead of having the consistency of butter, it stays liquid unless I put it in the fridge, where it gets hard as a rock. So I leave it out since the liquid is easier to use, but I miss that in-between state where its a soft solid so I can spoon it instead of pour it. Not going to run the A/C all day just for my coconut oil!

Summary: best coconut oil I have found
Text: I am happy to say that I found the texture in the jar to be harder then I thought (though it may have been a bit frozen from outside in the box). It definitely smells like coconut, like a mounds bar. I was so concerned about the popcorn tasting like nothing but coconut. I was VERY surprised buy the wonderful taste it gives the popcorn, I can't believe I never realized at the movies that the reason the popcorn taste so good is that bit of coconut flavor to it. It also left my popcorn machine very clean, when the other oil coated the whole machine in a greasy gunk. Combine with Eden Organics Organic popcorn kernels from Amazon for a total organic popcorn. I received a mini popcorn machine like you would find in a theater for Christmas. After going through the sample packs of yellow gunk oil that came with it for popping I searched for a more healthier and natural way to make popcorn. I read a lot about different oils people use, but one thing was always the same, if you want it to taste like at the movies use coconut oil.

I google the "coconut oil" and found it is great for health. Based on the review, I gave Nutiva a try and never regret. It smalls so good. I put one jar in my little kitchen and another one in  my bathroom. Besides cooking, I use it on my hair, too. Best ever! Loves it!

Summary: This is What REAL Coconut Oil Should Be
Text:
I've heard of the benefits of coconut oil towards overall health and how others have used this product for their hair and skin. I use this as a hair and skin conditioner. It is much easier to apply than extra virgin olive oil, but works just as well for healthy hair growth. As for my skin, I've stopped buying regular lotion because it softens and conditions it on its own.

I can't offer a review about cooking with this oil, although coconut oil in general tolerates higher temperatures than other oils due to its primarily solid state. I'll have to buy more and test it out:-)

This product is top notch. I eat this stuff twice a day by the spoonful, put it on my skin when I sit in the sun, and cook with it. It tastes great, smells great, and makes you feel great. Nothing more needs to be said than "TRY THIS PRODUCT". Tremendous stuff!!!

I use it for cooking and as a supplement. I take 2-3 tablespoons during my workout and I am totally pumped. This is a great product if you are doing low-carb and need that extra energy kick for intense exercise, since the MCT in coconut oil are absorbed and burned very fast. It also aids in weight loss. It tastes great, too.

this is the best tasting coconut oil i've had - maybe it has something to do with the care they take in processing it - and it's a great value for the 2-pack when you are not using it in great amounts- as i consume about a tablesspoon per day-

Summary: Wonderful oil, very happy with it
Text: This oil is so delicious , you can it with the spoon right out of the jar.  My kids love with honey on their toast.  Thank you

If this is as healthy as it claims to be, I can't imagine any reason not to buy it.  The taste is very light coconut flavor.  It melts easily and doesn't burn.  I put this on corn and it seemed to make sweet corn sweeter.  I have cooked with it too with excellent results.  I just love the taste and it is much more healthy than butter.  And, it smells so good!  I see this as a staple in my kitchen from now on.  I am so glad that I tried it!

Excellent quality!  Great for skin and hair care.  Even great for removing sap or any other icky stuff you may get on you from outdoors.  A little goes a long way on skin.  Also great as substitute on anything you'd usually use butter for.  Have used for cooking as well as just spread on toast.  Discount for subscribe and save great too!  Melts/liquid form at 76 degrees or above otherwise will be solid, sort of lard consistency, but melts easily.

I had recently become aware of the many benefits of coconut oil.  This oil does have a coconut flavor to it, but it isn't very noticable when used for cooking.  We have also been using it for my kids' ecsema.

Summary: Cant say anything that hasnt already been said!
Text:
Well it is coconut oil... So yeah, good stuff. lol I use it on my two month old's face and even in her hair for cradle cap. It works really well for a skin moisturizer especially for babies and toddlers because it is so mild and smells like food! I caught my three old daughter licking her hands after I put it on her one day.
I have yet to cook with it since I just started using it like a week ago, but I am actually planning on using it in the kitchen.

UPDATE:
I use this on a daily basis for cooking. I love sauteing mushrooms and onions in it, and my day doesn't go so well without my eggs fried in coconut oil. It is so good for you! Before anyone knocks the amount of saturated fat in it, do some research on the benefits CERTAIN KINDS of saturated fat. They are not all equal. I have also been using this as a diaper rash remedy for my two year old. It works way better than any other cream I have used. And I have used them all...

I purchased this and the shipment was fast which is a big plus. Ignoring the fact that it's in a plastic container, this stuff is awesome. It smells and taste just like when my mother makes coconut oil so I know that it's organic and all natural. All the other oils I've purchased usually have a strong overpowering smell and usually remain liquid even in cold temperatures letting me know they aren't good. I've made my own but it only makes a bit so I thought I'd try Nutiva and I'm glad I did. This stuff has the light nutty smell and solidifies quickly true to coconut oil. I'd definitely recommend this stuff.

I did a lot of research and EV Coconut Oil is the healthiest oil to use for high heat cooking. Don't mistake healthy for bland tasting either, the coconut flavor actually enhances the dishes I cook. The oil is solid at room temp, it quickly turns to a liquid when heated. I also use this product as a leave in hair conditioner. This is no exaggeration when I say it works better than any commercial hair conditioner product I've tried. It works well as a facial moisturizer too. To use it on your face or hair, just put some of the oil in your palms, it will be solid so to liquefy it rub both palms together in a circular motion, after a few seconds you will have a natural, effective skin and haircare solution in the palm of your hands.

folks -- read The Coconut Oil Miracle, by Bruce Fife; you'll see that there are tons of reasons to USE organic coconut oil, and Nutiva is excellent, although not inexpensive.  I use the autoship option, and the price and quality of this product cannot be beat ANYWHERE.  Once again, BLESS you Amazon!

I received a mini popcorn machine like you would find in a theater for Christmas. After going through the sample packs of yellow gunk oil that came with it for popping I searched for a more healthier and natural way to make popcorn. I read a lot about different oils people use, but one thing was always the same, if you want it to taste like at the movies use coconut oil.

I found the texture in the jar to be harder then I thought (though it may have been a bit frozen from outside in the box). It definitely smells like coconut, like a mounds bar. I was so concerned about the popcorn tasting like nothing but coconut. I was VERY surprised buy the wonderful taste it gives the popcorn, I can't believe I never realized at the movies that the reason the popcorn taste so good is that bit of coconut flavor to it. It also left my popcorn machine very clean, when the other oil coated the whole machine in a greasy gunk. Combine with Eden Organics Organic popcorn kernels from Amazon for a total organic popcorn.

I've purchased Nutiva in the past and have no complaints but now there is evidence that storing food in plastic can cause cancer because of the dioxin so I'm opting for the glass container.  Also a couple of months ago I purchased two of them for $13.00 now it's 26.00 so glad to see there are other brands in a glass container with the option to purchase only one at a reasonable price.

Bought this and my skin is glowing.  I use it on my face and eczema patches I have.  It is smoothing it out nicely.  I drink some of the oil and it is so fresh and pure.  In the summer it will be liquid but as it cools it solidifies.

Summary: Coconut oil can seep past the new opaque white plastic Jar.
Text: I really enjoy this oil; it's great for cooking and has many other uses as well. What I didn't like was the new upgraded opaque white jar that Nutiva now uses for the coconut oil. I have found that when coconut oil liquefies in hot weather some of the oil seeps through the bottom of the jar. I think it might be due to the process in which they make their new opaque plastic jars. There is a line in the middle where the two parts of plastic where joined together or where the plastic was molded and separated from the mold.  At the bottom of the jar the oil leaks through this mold line. In summer temperatures I have found some residual oil left at the bottom of the surface where I leave the jar. This was not a problem with the previous jars. Nutiva should address this problem right away.

Summary: I'm a faithful Nutiva fan: quality and value.
Text: You can't find coconut oil in many stores. While I hope that changes soon, I need to get my "fix".  Nutiva has a clean, lightly coconut scented product with good prices for the size. It's organic and cold pressed so heat hasn't rendered away any antioxidants and benefits. I use it like butter on bagels, and for my cooking oil. I use olive oil for salads because coconut oil is a solid under about 70 to 75. I also use it for oil pulling for dental health. I mildly dislike the plastic container but I've read that the grade is good and won't leach chemicals into the contents.

I use coconut oil almost exclusively now and had this set up to deliver monthly, but found a cheaper brand (Luana) at Wal-Mart, so had been buying that instead.  Well, ran out of Louana brand and found that I had a bit of this left from my last order.  When I opened it up the smell of coconut was a pleasant surprise.  I opened the louana tub again, no smell.  I love making popcorn with this oil and one of the things I liked was the coconut scent and flavor, mild though it is.  So I'm back on a monthly subscription service with the Nutiva again :)  It's a good value compared to others that I have looked at also.

Both are organic and cold-pressed. Barlean's Organic Oils Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 16-Ounce Jar discernibly smells more of coconut. The consensus seems to be that it has a smoother texture and stronger coconut flavor. So if you're eating it by the spoonful or spreading it on toast or want a shot in your smoothie, that would be the way to go, if you don't mind paying a little more.

I'm mostly using coconut oil for cooking, so I like the more subtle fragrance of Nutiva. I can use it for most anything that calls for canola oil without everything tasting of coconut--mostly it just adds a certain savory quality, like umami, and makes your kitchen smell amazing.

It's also great as a deep-conditioning treatment for hair. I leave it in for a few hours and my hair feels soft and unprocessed after washing it out with my regular shampoo. I love it because it changes the texture of my hair without weighing it down.

Very Very good oil. Smells like heaven..

Coconut oil has a lot of uses, the best one would have to be oil for popcorn. Gives it that movie theater popcorn taste.
The health benefits of coconut oil include hair care, skin care, stress relief, maintaining cholesterol levels, weight loss, increased immunity, proper digestion and metabolism, relief from kidney problems, heart diseases, high blood pressure, diabetes, HIV and cancer, dental care, and bone strength. These benefits of coconut oil can be attributed to the presence of lauric acid, capric acid and caprylic acid, and its properties such as antimicrobial, antioxidant, antifungal, antibacterial, soothing, etc

GREAT STUFF! Buy some today!

The product is good but pricey
When signed for subscription it was less immediately the next month the price went up

I FIRST ORDER THIS PRODUCT WHEN LOOKING FOR MORE NATURAL COOKING OILS. I READ A FEW REVIEWS ABOUT HOW THIS "NUTIVA ORGANIC EXTRA VIRGIN COCONUT OIL" SO DECIDED TO GO FOR IT. I PURCHASED THE TWO PACK SO I USED ONE FOR MY COOKING AND THE OTHER ONE I USED IT FOR MY PERSONAL CARE.I USE THE ONE IN MY KITCHEN FOR MY SMOOTHIES, MILK SHAKES, BAKING, AND DO FRY MY EGGS AND A FEW OTHER FOODS THAT WONT USE THAT MUCH OF OIL SINCE THIS OIL IS EXPENSIVE. I USE THE ONE IN MY BATHROOM FOR MY HAIR AS AN ANTI-FRIZZ AND IT DOES WORK FOR MY LONG LATINA THICK FRIZZY HAIR. I USE IT AS A SKIN MOISTURIZER AND IT LEAVES MY SKIN SOFT, BUT A LITTLE GREASY ON MY FOREHEAD AND SHIN, BUT NOT BAD BECAUSE I ONLY USE IT BEFORE BED. OH YEAH AND IT DOES MAKES YOUR STRETCH MARKS SOFTER TOO.

Summary: Product good, packaging needs to be improved!
Text: I bought the dual pack of this item and one of them spilled in shipping. The box arrived smelling of coconut, and full of oil, the oil that I paid for. The seal on the containers need to be improved. However the oil itself was everything promised. Smells like you can drink it from the container.

I have tried about 3 different kinds of cococut oil. One had almost no flavor, which I did not like. The other was right in the middle, but this Nutiva stuff is chock full of decious natural flavor. I practically do not cook without it!

I ordered a larger tub of this oil a while ago and used it up pretty quickly. I love baking with it so much. The smell is fabulous! However, after reading about ALL the other uses for coconut oil I decided to get the two jar option so I could have one in the kitchen and one for personal care. I tried the oil as a lotion for the first time today and I'm totally hooked. Not only is my skiing oh so soft, but the smell is fantastic (not overwhelming at all). Now my only concern is getting more oil soon.

The coconut oil's aroma when I put it on toast or rice is just heavenly. The taste is amazingly good too! Since it came in two tubs, I have one in the kitchen for consumption and the other one in my bathroom for my hair since I researched and found that coconut oil is supposed to be good for natural hair. My mane is definitely softer to touch although it is typically not course or difficult to manage. I just got it last week so will see how it goes. The hot oil treatment with coconut oil is next on my to-do list. Careful when you use it on hair though, when I don't wrap my hair, I wake up with zits (prolly from the oil on my pillow). Some say it works to relieve acne, some say it causes acne. I blame it for the acne I have since I had been acne free for weeks until I applied the coconut oil on my hair.

Overrall, I will be a regular buyer of this product.

I had been debating on buying a jar of coconut oil to try after having read about how versatile it is. I'm really glad I did and that I tried Nutiva first.
I use one jar for "lotion" and to put on my daughter's diaper area when I change her. I was very pleased to see that it absorbs quickly and it leaves your skin super soft. I'm prone to acne and I have yet to have a breakout from using it. It smells awesome too. I'm not sure about the effect it has on diaper rash. I think it's more for prevention than treatment.
The second jar, I keep in the fridge (it stays pretty hard in the fridge)and periodically eat a small spoon of it to help my acid reflux (I'm 24 weeks pregnant) and it tastes delicious. It's just like eating coconut flakes without all the sugar. I made a batch of fudge with a quarter of the butter substituted for coconut oil, and it came out so smooth and it tasted like a "Mounds Bar".
I would definitely recommend this to anyone, and I have.

Couldn't wait to open it, It was so smooth and creamy, The smell wonderful!  I use it for everything,in a smoothie on my skin in my hair. I loved it, This is my 4th or 5th  brand of Coconut oil, this is the smoothest,super soft.

i always get this and i use it for my hair, skin, nails, i eat it with food and drink it with smoothies. there isn't really anything i cannot use coconut oil for. this brand is great, although trader joe's now sells 16 oz jars of unrefined coconut oil for $5.99 but runs out quickly. that is when i buy this.

Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is pretty good but truth be told, this particular variety of coconut oil is exceptionally sweeter than the other brands which isn't really a benefit in my world.  I prefer just a taste of coconut- not to be overloaded with it.  Still, it is what it is.
This product so far has been easy to use and has met my expectations. I am new to using this type of product.

I bought this because I bought a microwave popcorn popper and Amazon recommended this. I was not prepared to be this impressed. Made the best popcorn I've ever had. Great taste, healthy and I will definitely be buying again and again.

As a senior citizen, my skin was really dry. As I get out of shower, I grab a hunk of this and start smearing all over. Slightly greasy at first but soon absorbs. My legs, arms and face are soft as a baby's butt Pleasant smell,  also just a hint of coconut. Also , seems to heal cuts, bruises, and other boo-boos. I'm a fan now!

I'm a health nut and have used coconut oil (many brands over the years)....Ran across this brand and after reading the good reviews decided to give it a try....i've found this brand is the smoothest, smells the best and melts faster than any other brand i've tried......i put it in my oatmeal, smoothies, cook with it in place of olive oil, bake with it in my breads and cakes, put it in my hair for conditioner almost daily and smooth it over my skin (especially my feet) nightly to keep my skin feeling soft......it feels oily at first of course but absorbs into your skin pretty fast......LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this brand!!!!

I heard all the hype about coconut oil and had to see it for myself.

So far, i have tried it in place of unsalted butter for baking with a lot of success. I made chocolate chip cookies using it - and used my exact recipe but swapped coconut oil for butter. The cookies looked a little different than usual, but had a delicious crispy exterior and chewy interior. In fact, my kids preferred them.

I also tried making brownies w/ them. I melted the coconut oil w/ my 63% chocolate over a double boiler and it looked more liquidy than when i do butter + chocolate. But i proceeded w/ the recipe and honestly, the brownies were delicious and i wouldn't have known the difference.

I have been using it instead of canola oil for my eggs in the morning -- again, great results.

I think it's an excellent cooking and baking fat and ordering it from amazon is very convenient. I highly recommend it.

I have a hair loss problem (female) and heard that this oil is an excellent conditioner. I apply a little amount to my hair, just enough to cover it from the roots to the tips, and a little to the scalp, and let it on for a couple of hours. After that I wash my hair a couple of times to perfectly remove all the "grease", and for a few days, even after a one or two additional washes, my hair feels so full of body and shiny that I love it (If you have few hairs you must make the most of them!!!). Be careful: if you apply too much and do not wash your hair properly you might get the contrary effect (a greasy dead hair stuck to your scalp)

It smells so good! just like a tropical sweet... I tasted it and it is not bad but it certainly smells better than it tastes... as a matter of fact I would say that it was almost tasteless to me. I read about the benefits of oil pulling (rinsing your mouth with it and making it pass between your teeth to remove bacteria) and it is not disgusting at all, I will continue and see how it turns out. This oil pulling alternative has also proven useful for a relative that has Alzheimer's disease as a complement to brushing his teeth, which he sometimes finds difficult to accomplish properly. Allegedly, oil pulling provides better results than using Listerine or similar mouth washes, which by the way can also be "too spicy" for children and the picky elderly because of their content of alcohol.

I have also applied it over rashes in the skin and minor scratches. Many people cook with it too, although I have not tried it for cooking.

Nutiva's brand of organic EV hexane-free coconut oil is awesome. First, I admit it's the first and only one I've tried, but after reading scores of reviews and my holistic health practitioner suggesting I take in 2 Tbsp. a day, I wanted the best. And at Amazon, you get the best prices, especially with Subscribe & Save (how great is that?)!

When I opened the jar the very first time, I was amazed at the deliciously fresh coconut aroma. It's intoxicating! I do like coconut, so that helps. But it took me a while to get up the nerve to heat it up and pour it into my frozen fruit smoothie (frozen banana, strawberries, blueberries, juice). I thought somehow it'd solidify back up and I'd get big chunk-o-fat globules in my shake. Not at all!

When I heated it up on the stove so that it'd liquify, the scent was of toasted coconut (mmmm, so yummy), so I thought it'd taste great in my smoothie. What surprised me was that it added no taste at all. I'm now using it every day, as suggested.

Then it took me a while to try frying with it because I figured it'd impart mild coconut flavor to my savory dishes (potatoes, chicken, eggs), which I wouldn't want. But I just tried it over the past two days, a little with scrambled eggs and a lot with searing boneless breasts of chicken (which were finished in the oven on a tray coated with more coconut oil). I tasted zero coconut flavor in any of it! I am so psyched about this! So now I'll be using organic olive oil for dressings and other raw applications and coconut oil with nearly everything else.

Also, I read that the plastic tubs it comes in are BPA-free...fabulous! Haven't tried baking with it yet, but I did use it on my very chapped hands, and it was great. Smells like ole Hawaiian Tropic!!! I love that beach smell!

I highly and enthusiastically recommend Nutiva Coconut Oil...it is awesome!!!!

Summary: Best Tasting Coconut Oil I've Tried:  Quality is A+
Text:
Nutiva's Organic coconut oil is the best I've found. I've tried several brands, but nothing tastes as clean and pure as this. There is a definite undertone of coconut, but I like the flavor, even when frying eggs or eating it on cinnamon raisin toast. I recently had bloodwork done and my HDL (the good cholesterol) was an impressive 77---anything over 39 is considered in range; over 50 is heart protective). I attribute this great HDL number to using only coconut oil, butter, and olive oil in my cooking & drinking green tea.

Amazon's Subscribe & Save offer is a great deal; I really like the 2 pack of these smaller (15 oz) jars. We're a small household and I like keeping one jar sealed while using the other. Keep in mind that coconut oil is different than other oils--it is solid at temperatures under 72, so it will look something like shortening in the wintertime. Still tastes great and is wonderful to use in all kinds of cooking.

One more important detail: this is an organic, COLD PRESSED coconut oil. Others may be organically grown, but I've found some brands are hydrogenated to make them solid at room temperature (I won't go into all the reasons this is not a "good thing"). Suffice it to say that any coconut oil you buy should be cold pressed (and that goes for your olive oil, as well). Google to find out why...

Happy eating!

Summary: amazingly delicious fresh coconut scent, beautiful white color, versatile, AND ORGANIC!
Text:
This is a marvelous product with some interesting health benefits (google it up). You can use it in baking, frying, in sauces, for vegan raw pies, mix with chocolate for puddings, moisturize your hair or skin, soothe rough elbows, etc.

This melts really fast in a pan, so you don't need a high heat. I fry eggs in it, and the coconut taste is subtle. Any ethnic dish that requires sauteeing or saucing and can benefit from a fresh coconut flavor, this is useful. I've cooked meats in it, as well. If you hate the smell/taste of coconut, obviously, this is not for you.

This brand, Nutiva, is organic and virgin. It smells so good. And I have an old jar that I never finished (really big one), and nearly two years later, after sitting right by the stove, it still smells fresh, like Cuban coconut candy my mom used to make. Yes, solid and fresh and white and fragrant TWO YEARS LATER. This is a very stable product.

Recommended.

I love the smell of this product.  I have tried other coconut oils, and they are not the quality of Nutiva.  You can use this for so many things.  It is a great, light-weight moisturizer.  I also love to put it on my hair.  It adds a great taste to smoothies, and I have also used it to cook with.  This is a very versatile product.  I love it.

Summary: 10 Ways to Use it; acne treatment, facial scrub, lip balm, nail strengthener etc
Text:
I came upon an article that recommended this product and it's 10 ways to use it so I though I would list them for other to see.

1) Moisturizer - massage into hands, legs, and feed -the oil's moisture locking lipids will give skin a soft glow.
2) Nail Strengthener - Work into nails to create a hydrating seal that will help prevent brittleness and hangnails.
3) Lip Balm - dot onto lips to keep them supple
4) Facial Scrub - to restore radiance, add a pocket of sugar to a dollop of oil and massage into face, then rinse.
5) Anti-frizz serum - Apply a dab to hair to seal the the cuticle and repel friz.
6) Deodorant - thanks to it's bacteria-killing lauric acid, smearing onto a glob of oil will nix foot and body odor.
7) Acne treatment - when dabbed on breakouts, the oil's lauric acid will gently heal acne without dehydrating the skin.
8) Anti-itch cream - swipe a film over bug bites or rashes, letting the oil's anti-inflammatory agents soothe the itch.
9) Lubricant - Sure, the oil is perfect for squeaky suitcase wheels, but a smidge also relieves "down-there" dryness.
10) Stomach soother - dissolve a spoonful in hot tea and sip. The oil's antimicrobial acids will help ward off indigestion causing bacteria and parasites.
11) cooking!

First things first: the flavour of this coconut oil is wonderful. Very clean on the tongue with just a slight back hint of coconut flavour. YES, this WILL slightly flavour some of your dishes to taste faintly of coconut if the dish is not heavily spiced. When I use coconut oil in place of butter for many Ethiopian and Indian dishes, I don't really notice any coconut flavour--but these are heavily spiced cuisines and so the sheer level of spice involved will cover up the delicate coconut flavour of this oil. In baking, however, there is a wonderful little hint of it. When I've made cookies and cakes using this in place of shortening or butter, many people have commented that something felt different about the dessert, but they couldn't put their finger on it right away until I would suggest coconut. I say all of this, though, in case someone who absolutely HATES coconut is considering using coconut oil as a part of their diet. While it has many great health benefits, if you cannot stand the flavour of coconut in any shape or form, you probably will not enjoy this product. I personally enjoy the added depth and dimension is gives my food, as well as the fact it's cholesterol free.

If you're thinking this wouldn't taste like anything, then you're thinking of what is called "RBD coconut oil", that is to say, coconut oil which has been refined, bleached, and deodorised. This is not that product, and in my opinion, is far superior to any RBD coconut oil you could find.

Now, the health benefits. Coconut gets props for being cholesterol free. Many people want to downplay its wonderfulness by pointing out that it is loaded in saturated fats. However! The saturated fats found in coconut oil are mostly medium-chain fatty acids, which bind together to form medium-chain triglycerides. Medium-chain triglycerides, or MCTs, are much easier for the body to break down and process than long-chain triglycerides, which are the saturated fats that are usually predominant in our diets. Because MCTs are so easily broken down in the body, they don't put a great strain on your pancreas or digestive system. Coconut oil is not a cure-all, however. It's not some miracle food (IMO), but I do think it should be seen as a healthy, viable alternative to butter and some cooking oils. Should it replace these other oils and butter outright? No, I don't think so. But I think it deserves a place of respect alongside your butter and olive oil in the kitchen.

Summary: Don't keep plastic spoon in jar!!!
Text:
I've been using this brand for a couple of years now. It has a light coconut hint at times. I use it for popping corn and I can't taste any coconut, other items like meats or veggies sometimes have a hint of coconut...it's not necessarily a bad thing.

I thought I would save washing a spoon each time I used this and put in a clear, plastic spoon (Kirkland brand) into the jar so I could reuse it. DON'T KEEP PLASTIC IN YOUR COCONUT OIL!!! About 1 week later I went to make popcorn and I pulled out the handle of the spoon with no bottom of the spoon to be found!!! The acid in the coconut oil will eat away at certain plastics! Had to throw the 1/2 full jar away! Lesson learned! Just reordered and went on subscribe and save.

Nice.

I bought this to add into my hair routine. And so far so good! I combine it with pure organic cold pressed olive oil- my hair loves it.

The quality and texture are great.
I like the containers- they're plastic jars which makes storing them a breeze.

I also use this on my skin sometimes, and it works GREAT. It really saturates into the skin- makes it very smooth and extremely soft. I actually use the olive oil/coconut oil combo on my skin, so I guess its both products at work... but either way it goes it'll leave you with softer skin.

It's a little messy for me because I have to transfer it into a smaller bottle, but I just started using the top of a straw/sippy cup as a funnel and that helps. The smell is strong, if you like coconut you'll love this. I'm not that huge on it, so at times its a bit much for me.

This is the best deal on on this product you'll find- 2 for $16 (and free shipping if you spend $25)... but I still wish it was more like 2 for $10.

Great Product. I have one jar in the kitchen. It doesn't spoil so one less thing in the fridge. I use it as a high heat oil for saute veggies. It works well and leaves a very light coconut flavor.

The other jar is in my bathroom. I use it on my skin instead of body lotion. Best ever! A little goes a long way. Can also be used on your hair - condition with some oil, then wash and rinse.

I love it

We use this oil for tons of things!  It cleared up our son's cradle cap (in 2 days), baby acne (in 3 days), eczema (in 2 days) and cuts/scrapes (usually the same day).  We use it for cooking and for sunscreen.  Great product!

I've tried a few different brands of extra-virgin coconut oil, and for the most part I'm equally satisfied with them all. Despite the marketing hype, coconut oil brands within each category (virgin, refined, hydrogenated) are very similar. I should specify the qualities I look for in a coconut oil: I want a coconut oil with a rich coconut aroma and taste, maximum nutrition, and minimal processing. For these reasons, I always select an organic, extra-virgin, cold-pressed oil.

I'm pleased that this Nutiva Organic Extra-Virgin Coconut Oil provides these qualities along with an easy-to-find "packed on" and "best before" date. The jars I ordered in late January 2011 were packed on September 13, 2010, and the "best before" date is September 13, 2012. Stored correctly (cool, dark location, no refrigeration needed), this nutrient-dense oil stays fresh for two years. It smells and tastes great--coconutty and slightly sweet.

According to Nutiva, no hexane is used in the processing of this oil. Hexane is a petroleum-derived solvent used in all kinds of industrial applications, from shoe manufacturing to roofing. Interestingly, because hexane's primary molecular structure is carbon, it can be passed off as "organic." Do a little research; "cold-pressed," "organic," AND "hexane-free" are key considerations when selecting your coconut oil for nutrition purposes.

I'm not as pleased with the plastic jars. In fact, I took off a star as a result of the plastic packaging. I feel that a quality organic oil should be stored in a glass jar, and ideally a dark one to reduce oxidation. I've actually selected coconut oils specifically because they come in glass jars, and might have bypassed this product if I hadn't found it on sale at a good price. I put this information in the review to aid those of you who are looking for a coconut oil in a glass jar.

This is a must have for all households.. So many things you can do with coconut oil... You'll never need another cream or lotion again.. not to mention its a great sunscreen.. The taste and feel of this brand is light .. I would definately recommend this brand..
Coconut oil can be used for a bazillion different things, and the tub is awesome and easy to use... Use It for your hair, skin, food, whatever you need. It's amazing

This is a wonderful coconut oil.  I have other used other coconut oils before, but I think this might be my new favorite.  This one is smooth, tastes and smells great, and is easy to get out of the tub. I like to use this oil in cooking, spread it on toast, I even use it on my face as a night cream!
It was a great deal and I got it! Shipment came on time!Nutiva is a brand I trust. And the coconut oil is so good for you and absolutely deliciouse!

After trying the coconut oil, I don't think I will ever go back to using butter. It is such a versatile oil. I love it on english muffins and it is really delicious in mashed sweet potatoes! AND you can put in on your body as a moisturizer that smells great and it all natural. I am hooked. Sign up for subscribe and save!

Text: I am so happy I purchased this item.  It was better than I expected and I will definitely order again.  The consistency was perfect and the taste heavenly.  I can cook with it and use it as a facial spa treatment.  What more could a girl want?

A friend noticed that I was using coconut oil, of another brand. The kind I was using was refined. She mentioned that I could get a way better deal on Amazon using Subscribe and Save. This is amazing. A must have.  I use this product daily.  I love the smell.  I have used many different brands but I like this one the best.
I love to cook with this, it gives a nice flavor and is very healthy for you.  It also makes a great moisterizer for your skin.

i love this oil! ive been using it for a couple years now, i cook with it and sometimes eat a spoonful of it a day, it cooks alot cleaner than olive oil and can cook a couple things without having to re oil the pan..trust me you'll love it too, when i cook fish it gives it a light taste of coconut...

Summary: One for Massage, One for Cooking
Text: We order this fabulous oil on autodelivery, receiving two jars every few months.  We use one jar for full body massage and the other for cooking. Simply use a knife to carve out chunks of oil - if you want to heat the oil up for massage, simply float a small bowl of oil in a larger bowl of hot water, and in no time you'll have silky warm oil, ready to lavish on your lover's body. Equally delicious in the bedroom and the kitchen, this oil will come to be a favored tool of pleasure in your home. Enjoy!

I love this stuff.  There is a light coconut scent.  I use it mostly for my scalp and hair because I have dry scalp and alopecia areata.  I dig out a very small amount...about a teaspoon.  I let it melt on my fingers, rub my fingers together, and then I just massage it into my scalp.  I do this at night, and wash it off in the morning.  It makes my hair feel soft.  I like to add a drop of lemon oil, lavender, primrose and/or rosemary and massage it in with the coconut oil.  It's a great all-natural stress reliever.  I have yet to use the coconut oil in cooking, but my mom says that when she was younger she used to use it for cooking (as well as her hair).  I sometimes use it for moisturizing my skin (everything but face), but it's important to rub it in very well since this is pretty greasy.  I will continue to buy this product!

I use this oil for my son as a moisturising oil after bath. This product is far better than other coconut oils I have used.It is a lot fresher than most sold in the market.
This also works as an excellent hair oil. I am very happy with this product.

Hands down that this is by far one of the top oils to use for cooking, baking, skin, hair, and overall health. LOVE this stuff and by far this is the best tasting coconut oil out there. Stay away from refined coconut oils as it is not as healthy. I take 3.5 tablespoons almost daily for over all health and for feeling good! I will continue to use this.

I recently started to change my eating habits, trying to be more healthy, going organic, eating the natural and raw stuff.... I stared cooking w/ this oil and found some many other uses for it, that now I am in love... I use on my hair, on my skin, my husband loves too it is amazing and w/ the subscribe and save it is even better.... great product.... I heard it is even good to use as a lubricant :-)... haven't use for that yet... but who knows....

will recommend it to anyone....

This product is a money saver!!!  Not only can you cook and bake with it, it is an excellent face and body cream, lip balm, and is a really good spread for toast and bible bread. So you can see that with the purchase of this one product, you get at least four different products in one tub!!!

Came across this randomly while searching for new health foods to try and was immediately drawn in by all the amazing claims and great reviews that coconut oil gets. I'm always open to trying healthier alternatives to things, especially when they taste better too, and this stuff fits the bill! So far I've made fried eggs, pan fried french fries, stir fry, and cupcakes and they've all tasted amazing!! I can smell and taste a very subtle coconut smell/taste in the foods that I use it in and I thought the french fries would taste totally weird but they actually turned out super yummy. The fiance, however, says he doesn't notice any difference (I'm a super taster though, so I'm not sure which one of us is more accurate). I've replaced my vegetable oil completely with this stuff and now I can't get rid of my half bottle of useless vegetable oil..I think you can use this to replace butter in recipes as well but I haven't tried it like that yet. I plan on buying a book on the subject of coconut oil and its health benefits so I can find out more about it. I'm going to buy the next size bigger of this next time since my first tub is already almost gone, I'm definitely hooked for life!

Bought it primarily to use for diaper rash ointment. It does a fantastic job of keeping nasty rashes away, and it cleared up the one my son already had (and it's cloth diaper friendly! triple win!). I've also used it as a leave-in conditioner and my hair was soft and shiny. It also makes for a good cooking oil (not from the diaper rash tub!), and the scent and taste isn't too heavy. Wish I knew about it before!

Summary: Smells good, tastes good! My dog loves it!
Text:
I bought this as a moisturizer for my Chinese Crested; she loves it! She usually hates it when I try to put lotion on her, but she loves this! Granted, she likes to lick it off, but if I really need to I can just put a sweater on her so she can't lick it ALL off.

This stuff also tastes good, smells amazing, and I've used it as a moisturizer as well. I designated one tub for "cosmetic purposes" and the other tub for the kitchen! =0)

This is the only type of coconut oil I've ever bought, and I see no reason to change brands because this one is so great.  I make chocolate bark with it, stir fries, and baked goods.  I love my coconut oil!  Subtle coconut undertones when eaten with sweet things, yet no coconut taste after stir frying (at least for me.)

This coconut oil is wonderful for baking, popcorn and even using as a lotion. I had not used it for making popcorn until recently and I must say it makes a healthy nutritious snack even more delicious than ever!  It is great for baked goods as well. Obviously, I find it extremely versatile.  The 2 pack is such a nice option. It saves me time and money.  Can you tell ,...?  I Love It !!!

LOVE this stuff! Since reading that olive oil is best just used for cold, not cooked items, I use it for cooking as well as a condiment on sandwiches, a spread on whole grain breads, and even added to protein shakes. It is soooo healthy. Anyone reading up on it should make sure they are reading current info--not old, no longer valid statements. I even use it on my face.

With a slight coconut flavor it's brilliant on toast or bagels! I use it instead of butter when frying breakfast foods mostly.
Outstanding product in quality and packaging. We have replaced our standard corn or vegetable oil with the coconut oil. Healthier and tastes better.

Coconut oil is not widely known for its health benefits (at least in the US) so I am trying to spread the word. It is great for cooking as a vegetable oil substitute and butter substitute in many recipes. Of course it contains no salt, so if a recipe is counting on the salt from butter as flavor (easy example is toast), then you may want to add some salt separately. But of course, most of us can use less salt in our diet.

Also, this is great for dry skin. It might take a few (5-10) minutes to absorb completely, but it works wonders.

I always had the impression that coconut oil is pungent with a strong taste. Probably I had only tried refined coconut oil.

On the contrary Nutiva is heavenly - untouched, unbromated, just out of the coconut taste!
I love this stuff. The taste is awesome and its very healthy for you. I will be ordering it again.

This stuff is good for your hair, skin, and to consume as I have learned! The taste goes great with many foods especially on thin bagels and english muffins but lots of other things too. I highly recommend!
This product is like magic. I used it as a pre-shampoo step and it made my hair stronger and I noticed less to none hair shedding when rinsing and shampooing afterwards.

IM A NATURAL,I THINK 4A/3B HAIR, AND THIS STUFF APPLIED AFTER U WASH YOUR HAIR,OR SIMPLY AFTER YOU WET YOUR HAIR AND RUB THIS ON YOUR SCALP AND HAIR,YOUR HAIR WILL BE SO SOFT..THE SMELL IS GREAT,WAY BETTER THAN OLIVE OIL.I LOVE THIS,I WILL BE GETTING THE 54OUNCE!!!!!!!!!2PACK!!!!!!!

I don't cook or heat up oils of any kind, but I do have dark skin that can look pretty dry at times, no matter what kind of cleansing I use. Instead of putting the dozens of chemicals on my skin that come in even the healthiest of lotions, Nutiva's Coconut Oil does the trick w/ a single, organic content. It smells good, but the scent is so light, that it's disappears shortly. If you're looking for a long-lasting, healthy, simply 'made' product to give you a healthy glow, give her a try. I loves it!

Summary: Popcorn taste so much better with this
Text: This oil smell so good and melt very fast.  The price was great.  I love popcorn and using this oil makes it taste even better.

This is a very good quality coconut oil, with a clean raw coconut taste and smell (not toasty or cooked), light silky texture, and excellent shelf stability.

I use it in smoothies, for some cooking and baking (mostly curries and sweet baking, it's fantastic in granola and brownies) and for body care. It's a very good moisturizer and you need very little, just a few drops smoothed over the entire body; and I use it for deep cleaning my facial pores once a week (google Oil Cleaning Method). When my hair was long, I used it for pre-wash conditioning and a few drops on the ends as a leave in conditioner. I use it to massage my stretched ear piercings and to rub into scrapes and cuts I think may leave scars.

None of these things are uses exclusive to coconut oil, I could use many different kinds of oils and fats, or different brands, but why? the bottom line is just that it's a good price for a high quality oil that fits the bill all around.

This is my first time using coconut oil, so I don't have anything to compare it to, but I must say that I like it very much.  I use it primarily for frying eggs and other pan fried things, and I love that the flavor is very mild and not overwhelming in coconut.  I was happy to learn that it's a healthy substitute for butter, so I look forward to using it in other ways.

Coconut oil has become the only oil I will use for cooking, especially organic ones. It gives food just the right amount of aroma and flavor. Nutiva is a major brand you can trust, though I've tried & used other brands from local healthfood stores as well. It annoys me that some books & health professionals still knock coconut oil as a fat to avoid on the premise that it's a naturally saturated fat, when in fact it's a tremendously healthy product. SOme say that it helps your body converts fat into energy better as well.
Received this a couple of days ago- it has a wonderful light flavor and I highly recommend it to everyone!

Summary: The absolute best coconut oil I have tried!
Text: A few months ago, I started using coconut oil. I have tried 3-4 different brands, but keep coming back to Nutiva. It is the best by far! Their coconut oil has a light, slight coconut taste, which is wonderful. It is delicious in cooking and treats as well.

I've tried lots of coconut oil over the years, but this brand is by far the best, so I keep coming back to it. The color is beautiful and white, and the smell is fresh and doesn't have the "off" scent some of the oils have. I love that it is organic and unrefined. I use it in cooking sometimes, but mostly, I use it as an after-shower body and face moisturizer. I rub it all over my body and then after about 20 minutes, use a dry washcloth to very lightly blot the excess off, so when I dress, I don't get oil on my clothes. This regimen makes a world of difference for my "chicken skin"--you know, those tiny red, raised dots a person gets on their skin when it's dry--keratosis pilaris, I believe it's called.  As a woman, I do NOT find them attractive at all. So, I highly recommend this oil for cooking, and for a wonderful moisturizer. Makes your skin feel young again--very smooth and not sticky at all. I find the price is great on Amazon too--what a bonus!
OMG this stuff is great!!!! smells good! I use it on my hair and for cooking!!! its the best! I buy mine from an health food store! anyhow good buy !

Summary: Nutiva Coconut Oil is terrific--be careful ordering it from Amazon!
Text: I knew my coconut oil had arrived because of the dark, oily spot spreading over the outside of the box. The two containers were bubble wrapped with no other packaging around them so they were rolling around in the box while in transit. I called Nutiva who said that Amazon was the seller and packager of their product. (The guy also said that Amazon has some of the worst packaging of items like this in the industry.) The Nutiva guy said that I got a really good price on their product, but with results like I had, I guess I didn't get a good deal as only one container was sealed and safe to use. I am a huge Amazon fan for many things, but unless I get assurances for packaging improvements, I will hesitate before ordering perishable items in the future.
When you initially open this jar, your senses will be absolutely delighted!! The smell is fantastic! And, the look and consistency makes you eager to dig in ;) Love it!

I love this product, and I love the auto-ship. Best bargain around. I have never had any issue with my orders as recent complaints that I have seen. Those complaints should be on feedback of SELLER - NOT Product! I am not going to be happy if my subscription is going to be canceled. I am feeling as if Amazon is trying to get out of honoring the subscription price they offered, and want to increase the prices.

Summary: Great product at a great price
Text: I was very happy with this product.  Coconut oil in mac and cheese gives it a little hint of tropical taste without overwhelming the dish. I ordered this in February (the cooler part of the year) and it arrived in perfect condition.  Some others have written that they were not happy because it apparently leaked all over the place.  This is probably due to the product becoming liquid at 76 degrees.  My oil was solid when it arrived and did not have this problem.  I hope Amazon can resolve this issue quickly.

I really like this product a lot. It is a really GOOD deep conditioner for my hair. I use one jar for my hair and skin and the other jar for cooking. I am greatful to Allah for this product. For my hair, it adds shine and strengthens my hair and conditions my scalp very very very well. Plus, it softens my skin. For cooking, it is way better than butter. I really like the taste of this product, fresh and pure. For me, it has replaced my hair conditioners and it has replaced butter!! Really like the health benefits of using Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil. The product arrived on time wothout being busted up or dented. Product came with an under cap seal to lock in freshness. I am very very HAPPY with the seller. Excellent price (free shipping); and excellent product. I will buy more of this product in the future. Thank you again Amazon! :)

Summary: Great natural moisturizer - even revived an old leather chair!
Text: I've been using this as a moisturizer on my dry, itchy winter skin and have been very pleased.  It seems greasy at first, but within minutes it is absorbed and doesn't get on your clothes.  We had a leather chair that was getting too dry and was cracking so I thought, why not give it a try?  It worked great.  No more expensive leather conditioner for us.  I will be buying more.

I've tried a number of different brands of coconut oil. And so far, this is the best I've tried. I actually started using coconut oil for my skin as I have suffered with very dry skin my entire life. It absorbs quickly and since I love the smell of coconut, it was perfect for me. But don't worry, if you don't love the smell of coconut, it fades pretty quickly. I then started using it as an oil treatment for my hair with fantastic results. Finally, I'm starting to incorporate into my cooking. Needless to say, I am very pleased and will just put this on auto ship!

I just received Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil. The real surprise was cooking with it. It was very very light and untraceable in some foods, yet added a very nice fragance and taste to one of my stir fry recipes. I hope the long term health benefits are as claimed. I am already pleased with the direct effect it has had on my skin and hair. I can already recommend it. Make sure you don't buy anything that's been processed, filtered or has additives. This is the real deal.
So far, so good.

I used the coconut oil to moisturize my skin and it does just that.  Although the product probably wasn't solely intended for this purpose, I've read that it can help with dry skin.  The smell could be better, but again, the product wasn't specifically intended for this use.  It melts at body temperature and glides on very nicely.

This stuff is amazing.  The smell is warm and delicious, and yet it never overpowers a dish because after cooking it is less strong.  It makes cooking more enjoyable just because of the delectable smell.  The price was right as well.  I could go to five stars if I'd compared it with more products.  Otherwise, I'd buy it again on the yummy smell alone.
Gives popcorn that movie theater sweetness and nuttiness.  Keeps on the shelf for many months, smelling as fresh and coconutty as when first opened.
have used this product for a while this is great for cooking and it gives it a nutty taste like roasted potatoes, and i love to have a tea spoon of raw coconut once a day..... Voila!!!

Ive been using this brand like 2 years know..I use this on my relaxed hair and as a body moisturizer I mix this with the Dessrt Coconut Lotion, I use this on my 5 year old son as well I even got my boyfriend loving coconut oil, u can't go wrong with coconut oil, I love it

I purchased this for use with a popcorn machine I bought for my husband's Christmas gift. After the first few batches, he declared the coconut flavor in the popcorn was too noticeable, and bought another type of oil. I'm enjoying using the remaining coconut oil for everyday cooking (hubby won't eat cooked veggies, so I make them for myself), and am considering trying some as a moisturizer.
I'm using this on fruit toast (cranberry, etc) in place of butter.  Love the very subtle hint of coconut. Trying more uses soon.
This has so many uses.  I'm glad i have two !  It is wonderful on the skin.  It is also terrific to take daily.  i stir some in my coffee first thing in the morning.
Excellent product. Provides all the benefits of coconut oil and is easy to use. And it is almost half the price of the local nutrition store.

i love this brand, it smells and taste so good, well worth it. i put it in my toddler son's milk as an extra booste to his nutrition and he loves it. Good for hair and skin too; great all around for health.
This is by far the best coconut oil out there.  I have tried many but some taste and/or smell rancid.  This product is fresh with a hint of sweetness.  I will never buy any other brand again.

I've used Nutiva Coconut Oil for over two years now, and I'm so happy with it. There are just so many health benefits to using coconut oil, so its the no brainer oil of choice for cooking. Before finding Nutiva brand, which is a great value, I used several others brands - but Nutiva tasted the best and was the best value. Nutiva has an incredible flavor, and yes, it does taste like coconut.. which is a good sign that the oil is a good quality and not de-odorized with chemicals. If you're on the face, just order this and you'll never look back.

Not only is this product good for adding nice flavors for cooking, but My wife also uses it as a face and body moisturizer. She says that it is much better than any lotion or cream and you can also use it as a leave-in hair conditioner. And Amazon's price makes it affordable.

This is our favorite coconut oil. Excellent taste, and when you purchase with the "subscribe and save" option it is a very good value. Our local grocery stores charge nearly twice as much for one bottle. The health benefits of the medium-chain fatty acids (saturated fats) in coconut oil is what convinced us to try this oil. To learn more about the health benefits I recommend the Weston A Price Foundation's web site or Mark's Daily Apple web site as  good resources.

Not only can you use this product for cooking, but I also use it as a face and body moisturizer. It's much better than any lotion or cream and you can also use it as a leave-in hair conditioner. And Amazon's price makes it a great buy.

This stuff is pure coconut heaven in a jar. I put it on after the shower & before bed and it moisturizes excellently with the fragrance of coconuts. Its quite greasy at first as it melts with body heat but gets absorbed rather quickly. My cuticles, elbows, heels thank me. It really does have antifungal and antibacterial properties. I've had it for a couple of months and am not even half done with the jar. As a hair conditioner it didn't work for me because it was too hard to rinse out, my hair was weighed down for days. But, I put this on my now baby soft skin religiously. I will buy another tub to try cooking with.

I originally bought this coconut oil for making cold process soap. But, after reading more in depth about the many ways it can be used, I started using it as a deep conditioner for my hair.
