The coconut oil works great on my hair and skin. my hair responded great to the oil and it grew a little because of the oil.
I'm taking this product since last week (just 5 days until now) and will see the results soon. The flavor is good and the quality too, the delivery was ok.
I love coconut oil it is great for all sorts of stuff! I use it as a lotion and for oil pulling! This is a wonderful product!
This is by far the best coconut oil ever.....its so light,and melt right in your hands......I would most def. Recommond this coconut oil to anyone....I use it for my hair and it works great!!!

I love this product. I bake with it and use it on my skin.  I have always had an issue with dry skin, but the Coconut Oil keeps my skin moisture all day. I especially love it on my natural hair, no more dry scalp. I have recommended this to most of my friends. Will buy more in the future.

I know this is a great product. My chiropractor puts it on her toast!  You can also mix it with strawberry jam and use it on toast. It works extremely well as a hand cream, but it is hard and not creamy until you warm it up.

I bought this and another brand to try and both are equally as good.  I do like the clear container that this comes in though better so this is the brand I will stick with.  It comes in a clear plastic container and I don't notice any plastic taste as others have commented on coconut oil in general.  I just put a big spoonful in my magic bullet when I make smoothies!  So yummy!!  You can eat this straight out of the jar if you want to also.  It is good!  When I first got it (shipped in the winter), it was pretty firm and I had to scrape it with a spoon to get it out..like candle wax.  But once it warmed up a bit..just room temperature, it is very soft now.  It still is a solid though, but easier to work with.  It is similar to the inside of an Almond Joy candy bar at room temp.  I can't comment on health affects since I am a relatively healthy person with bloodwork that shows great results..so far, but am only 34 yrs old.  I love coconut and hope it can help with brain function, memory mostly..lol.  I hope if I start taking it now, it will help long term. Once I run out, I will be getting the largest jar for my money!  My husband and kids love the smoothies made with this! It's not overpowering either..just the perfect hint of coconut among the other fruit and veggies. I made mango, pineapple, banana, and coconut smoothies that were just awesome!! Even all blended up well, you can still see the tiny white coconut flakes within the smoothies. Just yummy!!

I use this coconut oil for cooking, face cream and as a nutritional supplement.
The quality is extraordinary! Once you try this you will not want any other coconut oil.
this is a great product. excellent taste. great price and value. if you're looking for coconut oil to add MCT's to your diet, this is a great option.

I use this on my hair and on my skin after my bath or shower.  It is light so it doesn't weigh down your hair and gives your skin the moisture it needs without being greasy.  I've seen a big difference in my skin and my hair since using this over the last 4 months. Great product!

I love this product. I love the smell, the taste and the way I feel when I use this product. I try to use it in every way possible. I put it in my oatmeal for a satisfying,longlasting hunger satisfier. I also spread it on toast instead of butter. Yummy, what a treat and so healthy!
We use this in place of a lotion for our 5 month old.  It is light, very moisturizing an has a subtle coconut smell, which is something that was missing from the last kind we tried.

I found this product to be great for many different reasons. It can be used to soften hands, liven up hair and best of all is the rich flavor it gives your food when cooking with it. Your food tastes better and you don't feel weighed down like other oils make you feel.

Summary: What can I say? It is what it is.
Text: I don't use this for cooking really. I tend to use EVOO and grapeseed oil for that. However this works wonderfully for hair masks and as a supplement.

I am so happy I found this product, I actually just ran out of my coconut oil that I ordered from a online site, so I was looking for something I could get my hands onto all the time. Great smell, and plenty to last me. Im natural, with a 4c hair type and this is the best for my hair along with other carrier oils or alone! Great plus that I got to use the free trial of amazon prime!! I will be buying this product again.

This is so wonderful that I have to put it on the saver program with Amazon.  I use this for everything, from cooking to putting it on right after the shower to putting it in mine and my children's hair before I condition wash our hair.  I even put it in my Chai tea and it's wonderful on toast, infact it's so great that I don't need any other type of spread like mayo or anything, it's absolutely delicious.  My youngest doesn't like the smell but what does she know, she's only 9, everyone else in the house loves it.  My first jar lasted about a month, but I had to split some of it up so I'd have some in the bathroom and the rest in the kitchen.  I like that it doesn't liquify until you put in on your skin, it only liquified once(it was over 75 degress where I had it) and I put in the frig, however; when I took it out it was too hard.  You'll be very happy when you purchase this and needless to say it came very quickly, I'm on the prime membership so I rec'd it in 2 days.  I love it so much that I'm having a fit because I ran out. Just another note for this (3/12) this stuff cleared up my eczema, I mean it's gone and my skin glows.

ProfileName: Redistribution of wealth will save America
Text: I had come across compelling reasons online to add this to my daily nutritional supplements so I bought this product and I have to tell you before I opened the jar I was skedish about downing a tablespoon of this stuff so I first added it to my oatmeal and it actually enhanced the flavor.  My next move was to allow it to liquefy and then I downed a tablespoon of it right out of the jar and I was delighted how wonderful it tasted.

Simply put, I LOVE this stuff! I originally purchased it to replace butter in the kitchen. When I broke it open I was taken in by the smell...it was amazing. I was a little concerned because it smelled kinda sweet, so I wasn't certain if it would alter the taste of my savory dishes. It made them taste better than butter ever did! After doing a little more research I found there are SOOOO many other beneficial uses. So, I have taken to using it on my hair and skin. In fact, I had a little eczema episode on my wrist that the coconut oil healed in less than a week and it has not returned. Highly recommended.

I can't say enough about this wonderful product, and the amazing properties that it has... I use it in my oatmeal every morning, spread it on toast, cook with it, and use it on my skin. I began using it in Jan. of this year, after viewing the "Alzheimers" videos on F/B.
I put one tablespoon in my oatmeal everyday, as well as using it as a spread, etc.
My energy level is definitely elevated,and my skin is like silk..
Lots of potitives with this product.

Summary: Solid in the jar but starts melting in your hands!!!
Text:
This is really a fantastic product. Ordered it for my hair. I have fine brunette chemically treated hair. Doing wonders for my hair and my skin.
I love how it looks so solid in the jar but starts melting in your hands. It also does not run down your neck like the olive oil does!
It is a massive jar which can last years and I love the smell!

I am using this for both health benefits (consumption) and for cosmetic purposes (application.) The product arrived on time in perfect condition. It tastes wonderful, feels great on my skin and has a very pleasant aroma. Everything that I ordered arrived very quickly and was packaged altogether because I used the free Super Saving shipping option. Fantastic! Overall, I am pleased with this product as it is the healthiest coconut oil that I could find without paying exorbitant prices. Thanks!
Great item has many uses! I use it in my hair, on my body as a moisturizer, in my food and also as a supplement. It's the best and for a very good price.

I love this coconut oil! I use it on my body, face, and hair. It also smells and tastes delicious. I can eat it plain, but one of my favorite ways to eat it is with some mini chocolate chips sprinkled over a spoonful of it. Yum! I also like to cook french toast in it and top my sweet potatoes with it. My only complaint is that it's a little grainy. I don't notice it so much when I eat it, but I do when I'm using it as a moisturizer. It's not that big of a deal though. And to be fair, this is the only coconut oil I have ever bought so I can't compare it to any other brands. I love it so much, though, that I have no reason to try any other brands.
Really softens the skin and works well in the summer.  I mix this with Shea butter often for optimal results.  I also add some to a nice bath and it really does wonders on the skin.

This is an excellent product. I use it as a body moisturizer, my daughter uses it on her hair and I have also used it for cooking! It has a very delicate fragrance (even my boys thought it smelled nice). The taste is very mild and slightly sweet -- great for cooking. It is very hard but quickly softens in your hand. Amazing product! I am ordering more as a gift for family members who don't like all the chemicals in lotions!
This organic coconut oil was exactly what I hoped it would be.  I use it for my very dry skin and it really does the trick!

Very fresh oil with a creamy coconut flavor that melts on your tongue.  Solid at room temperature, but liquifies quickly.  I use it as a lotion and for my hair, nutritional supplement, occasional eye makeup remover, and sometime drinking chocolate mix-in.  Also used it in my morning smoothie, with frozen pineapples and milk, to make a pina colada-style drink.

I love this coconut oil it is everything I was hoping for and then some! I use it for my hair and face and wow. I have frizzy, dry, curly hair and since I've been using the coconut oil my hair is smooth, straight and dandruff free!! I've had a horrible experience with an acne treatment and burned my eye sockets and the coconut oil has restored them back to normal and even made a few improvement because I see less wrinkles. I wanted to use this for my high cholesterol but have yet to start taking it as a supplement. From tomorrow on I will. =) Great buy, try it!

This stuff is a GREAT moisturizer!!! All natural and coconut oil has a natural sunscreen!! Smells great, absorbs well. I use it on my face and Im not greasy at the end of the day. Great for all over body! Rough elbows, feet, wonderful on hands! Truly a great product!

Summary: Ease into if you're not used to it, pure quality product
Text:
You can taste the coconut. It's slightly sweet. I took about a generous tablespoon in my first ingestion attempt. Mind you, I've previously used other coconut oils before, but I would have to say the were greatly inferior to this product.
I felt ill to the stomach within 30-45 minutes of consuming the tablespoon...I did what every American does, I googled. Turns out that it's common for those who have an overabundance of yeast in the system. I drink tons of beer, well Belgian wheat ale to be exact, and the coconut oil reportedly acts as a detox according to some holistic opinions. I'm willing to give it a further try. I think it's best that you ease into coconut oil therapy vice gobbling a juicy tablespoon of it. I will update this review in a few months, but few on people on Amazon report experiencing any malaise from consuming coconut oil and I had to do a quick search to learn how common it is.
Otherwise, I concur that this is a superior product and if any true benefit would be redeemed from ingesting coconut oil, this would be one of the key ones to try.

This is a good & refreshing product. You don't need much to use in a fry pan, But the only thing I noticed is that it is like wax. I thought it w/be like how it is explaned on page, "An Oil" ~ Oils pour out, and this doesn't ~ you have to use a knife or hard spoon to get out.

BUT, I MUST TELL YOU ~ I did like how it tastes as long as it's cooked w/something. I broke up pieces of 1 flour tortilla in just a regular frypan frying till I liked it ~ chrunchy crisp. Then put on paper towel to absorb any extra oil, then powdered......Mmmm, it hit the spot. It made such a simple item into a great tasting snack for my cravings. Haven't used long enough to tell if it's a energy booster. ALL IN ALL, EXCEPT FOR THE WAXINESS OF IT, IT DOES FRY THINGS GOOD.

DOTTIE T., ERIE

feels great, smells great and tastes great. pure and heavy. cook
with it, spread it on your skin and enjoy it.

I purchased this coconut oil to use on my dry skin and to make my own facial wipes. Coconut is a natural antibacterial agent, so it's perfect for a facial wipe. The smell is great, very mild coconut smell, it's a great moisturizer, I use it as a hair treatment - the only thing I haven't done is use it as a supplement but at this price you could do so easily!
I purchased this product for my daughter's hair because it was getting dry I'm not sstisfied for it with the hair but its great for the skin.

I purchased this product for moisturing and body rubs,(massages). It works well as both, does not stain clothing because the melting point is lower then skin temperature. The only thing I do not like is the odor is stronger then I like.

This is a great coconut oil. It tastes good and is very good used in cooking. i will order again. I take a tablespoon every morning and also cook with it.

I am diabetic and have awful dry skin. Coconut oil is wonderful for skin, hair, fact. etc.

I've used this as a moisturizer for my scalp and for my body for a little over 1 month now. It has stopped my scalp from becoming dry and flaky like it used to do, yet it's light enough to not make my hair greasy (I have relaxed hair with the usual "new growth"). This makes my skin feel soft and absorbs pretty easily, especially after the shower. I also love the light coconut scent.

I got this because I read on a forum I frequent that it helps with "chicken skin," which I have unfortunately carried over from my teenage years. "Don't worry about it," my parents would assure me, "that goes away when you get older." No, mom, I don't think so. I'm in my 20s and still have rough skin on the back of my arms and it's not fun. I've tried $50 creams, exfoliating scrubs, etc. from high end brands, and nothing has ever really worked. I've only used this a couple of times and I already feel a huge difference. I just use it right after the shower and it absorbs into my skin wonderfully. I liked it so much after using it the first time, that I used it on my legs, hands, etc. and my skin everywhere is softer than it has ever been. I even tried it on razor burn(I get the WORST razor burn), and it really helped soothe it overnight. I usually buy products for specific uses and this is my first time trying something completely natural on my skin, but I'm so glad I did. Try it, it's so much more worth it than all the more expensive, chemical-filled products out there!

Summary: Coconut Oil is good for almost EVERYTHING!
Text:
This stuff is amazing, I'm so glad I discovered it.
I originally purchased it for my dog after reading that it's good for them.
His coat is amazingly soft and shiny (I am also giving him humic minerals, so that's not all just the coconut oil).
After I developed a horrible case of Candida, I started using this for everything!

The candida is making my hands and feet unbearably itchy, and my mouth developed oral thrush (red and inflamed under my tongue with white spots) Putting the coconut oil on my feet followed by a couple pairs of socks, completely stops the itching.
And after putting coconut oil and occasionally plain yogurt under my tongue for about three days the thrush is almost completely gone.
I have noticeably more energy after using the coconut oil for food and such for a few days in a row.
I use this all the time. I fry eggs, put on bread instead of butter and use it on my skin. I love the taste and smell. Absorbs well into the skin.

This is the best tasting oil I've used.

Try reading the "coconut oil miracle" book.

You will learn why soy and so many other oils have been replaced in processed foods and how that has helped to increase so many of today's diseases and illnesses...

Medium chain fatty acids are the key, like that in coconut oil... they do not go rancid and oxidize when exposed to heat, air or light as vegetable oils do due to their much higher heat capacity.

Plus, amazon sells is cheaper than the markets...as much as 50% cheaper...

I tasted 2 diff organic oils and this tasted better and more rich in flavor. At first I was grossed out cuz it reminded me of bacon grease, as I saw other reviews mentioning that =P After a couple bites in one setting, I developed a taste for it. I decided to make eggs for my dogs, myself, and my son and they were WEIRD BUT DELICIOUS. I will try sneaking this into my fiancee's food to see if he can taste a difference. What's weird is I felt full instantly and usually I eat alot so I can see where this is a good staple to my diet in losing excess weight =)

I love this oil... I mostly use it for my natural hair and it works wonders.. I have used it for my skin as well.. I'm not really a fan of the smell of coconut in general but this isn't as overwhelming as I thought it would be... Overall a great buy..

i read a lot about this stuff, this was the best priced option available to me, i like the hint of coconut it leaves on foods i cook with (very light hint but doesnt interfere with the taste of the food), if you dont like coconut at all, you wont like this. i also drop a tiny bit in my dogs food, since its is very healthy for me and them as well (good for their coats). i even spread some of this on a peanut butter sandwich.. thats a fatty sammich but yummy! :)

Pros:
+cheap!
+all natural and cold pressed!

Cons:
-taste might be an issue for some but not because of brand

***** 5x star product!

This coconut oil tastes just like eating sweetened flake coconut in a liquid form! It has a wonderful mild flavor that goes brilliantly in both savory and sweet dishes. Just this morning, I poured a teaspoon on some cold cantaloupe and it was just fabulous!!! Can't beat the nutritional benefits of coconut oil with a better tasting product!
I like this product, the price, and the shipping time. I have already recommended it for family and will continue to buy it in the future.

This coconut oil replaced my skin conditioner and lotions.  Smells good, moisturizes my skin, and is all-natural.  Last week I tried to order more, but they no longer have their free shipping, so I will be choosing a different brand of coconut oil, or buying directly from the store.

Product arrived quickly and in perfect condition. The extreme heat made the oil into a liquid form upon arrival. After letting it sit, it turned back into it's normal consistently. I used for my hair as I transition from a relaxer to a normal state. Haven't used to cook at all. It's a great addiion to my collection of hair products. Natural hairdresser said to use when hair is in natural state ONLY. Do not use when applying heat since the product is a 'heavy'.
I used the coconut oil as a substitute for butter in one of my favorite cookie recipes.  It worked well and made a somewhat healthy recipe even healthier.

The first thing I noticed about this brand of Coconut Oil was the smell. It is so sweet it made me want to start eating it right away. I use Coconut oil for baking and also as a moisturizer. I have not been disappointed at all with this brand.

I bought this because I have eczema and I read coconut oil could help keep skin moist and prevent flare-ups.  I also knew it was a delicious choice for cooking and baking.  With both those applications and the effect I get when I use it on my hair as a pre-shampoo moisturizing treatment, it's really great.  I bought this brand at the store, really liked it, read reviews of it and others, and decided the lovely smell, the smooth texture and the subtle taste were ideal.  It's a great product and I recommend it to people all the time.
I enjoy mixing agave nectar with this coconut oil and using it as a dip for fruit & nuts! What a yummy nutritious treat!

Ordered these to try them out and I must say this product is top notch. The oil smells and tastes like coconuts and it just appears of high quality. It gives some dishes a slight hint of coconut when used in cooking. I love this stuff. Will definitely keep ordering.

I've been using this product for a year now and I want to say that it smells really good.  I use it to seal moisture in my hair.  I read on the package that you can also cook with it.  I haven't tried that yet, but it smells good enough to cook with.  I worried about the oil becoming solid in cooler temperatures, but surprisingly it stays liquified no matter what temperature.  It's not greasy at all... very light and coats the hair shaft well.  I highly recommend!
this is one of the best flavored coconut oils ive found so far. very light .. nice value also.. highly recomend this brand

Summary: Best coconut oil for whatever purpose
Text: I've literally tried over 3 different coconut oils for my hair and this bh far is the best. It smells good, the texture is shiny and pure, and the cost is pretty good. This is excellent for hair( even black hair). Since I've been using this I have been able to retain my lenght.
This is a amazing coconut oil its 100% real coconut oil which is good and it smells light and crisp yum! I use it in my hair every night and its so smooth and shiny
This Coconut oil has excellent flavor and consistency, I recently seared a couple of pounds of Ahi tuna in it and it was the best I have ever eaten.
My hair gets very soft and shine wit this oil. The only negative is that your hair will get stiff in cold weather when using it. Other than that, I love it!!
Unlike other coconut oils, this oil has a very nice coconut fragrance that permeates the food as well giving a very pleasant taste.

I was looking for a healthy alternative to olive oil, this was, compared to Whole Foods prices, a GREAT deal. And coconut oil had been recommended to me by 2 separate friends that are amazing cooks and very very healthy people.  We made stir fry with it and won't go back to regular cooking oil, incredibly flavorful and I would say "gourmet".  There are instructions that this oil is meant for temperatures 350 and under. Baked a white birthday cake at 350 degrees with this oil and the cake had a great coconut flavor but came out drier.  But kids still devoured it.  Came super fast via mail, and a friend was right in recommending me buying this on Amazon vs. the store.
I use it for everything really...from cooking, to skin moisturizing, to hair balm. Works great! Even my pets love it.
I use coconut oil in whatever I cook.  I also use it as a substitute for shortening in pie crusts, biscuits, etc.  It's consistency is close to shortening at room temperature.
I love this and a far better price than other stores. It has so many uses....but as a body lotion you can't beat it!

Summary: Great product.  Terrific for popcorn, and very healthy.
Text: I can't say enough good about this product.  Love the taste.  Love the quality.  Outstanding for cooking and imparts a subtle coconut flavor.  The only con is that it can generally be bought for around $5.00 - $6.00 on special at the supermarket. Regular price is about the same.

I love raw organic unprocessed coconut oil and this brand I use quite often - both for sauteeing or just 'taking a swig' in the morning with a piece of toast (a version of dipping the bread into olive oil). I live in pretty warm climate, so most of the time it maintains runny consistency. In the winter it gets solid, but still very easy to work with.
I use it to make my own homemade chocolate (without white sugar) and with great results.

I also make my own skin moisturizer with shea butter, argan oil, avocado and coconut oil and couple of drops of lavender oil. It feels and works spectacular both on the skin or tiny amount on the hair.

It's just all around marvelous product and if you have not yet, definitely try it!!

I really like this product after having used it for the last 3 months as a substitute for both my cooking oil to reduce my fat intake and my assorted moisturizing products for my skin and hair.  I love the smell of the product while cooking and it does give the foods you cook with it a nice taste; I especially like cooking my chicken with it.  I have been using it on my hair and have noticed that my hair has a sheen and weight to it which I used to have in my younger days.  So far, so good...

I take 1 spoonful of the coconut oil every day, my nails and hair are growing stronger and fast. my skin looks shiny.  The smell is wonderful, good taste. I even use it as a deodorant. It deserves 6 stars. I will recomend 200%.

I am not a huge fan of coconut oil but after my first baby I decided to ol my body before shower just to get some relief from body aches and tension. I tried parachute coconut oil that is pretty famous in India but then I realized that it did not suck that well into my skin so I decided to check Amazon for coconut oil and came across this product that has 5 stars. I decided to give it a try and within two uses I became a huge fan. This oil does not take time to penetrate skin and I felt so good after my shower. I am totally in love with this product and plan to use it for many more years. Love, love, love it. Yet to use it in food but will surely give it a try since it smells so fresh and good!

Summary: Although it's a great product... it has increased from $8.32 to $14.99!!!
Text:
I had to write something about it and let others know about the price increase...
"Nature's Way Organic Coconut Oil, 16 Ounce has increased from $8.32 to $14.99." I guess there's coconut shortage.

Summary: Very good product, but a 60% price increase in a week?
Text:
I bought a jar of this thing on Aug 16 for seven bucks (and free delivery if over Amazon's minimum for such). It came pretty fast, in a semi-liquid state but not leaking; rather well packaged. I let it melt completely in a warm room (CO melts at about 80 deg F) and then put it in the fridge to let it solidify. One of the reasons I did (and always do) that is to smooth out the texture: as is, every type of CO I've tried comes in like a bunch of white fibers stuck in more even liquid, but if you thaw it completely and then freeze, it becomes all evenly semi-transparent, like one thick candle sort of thing. It probably doesn't matter; just a personal quirk, I guess.

Anyway, this is good stuff: the taste is nice -- very good for sweetich things like carrots or plums, for example (I always have a bowl of very lightly steamed carrots around, and I snack on them, taking one and dipping it into CO, which is good for two reasons: first, it tastes great, and second, carotene is fat-soluble so you need to combine carrots with some sort of fat or it won't be used by the body well).

All in all, there isn't much to say -- CO is CO is CO; this kind is no different from other types I've tried. CO in general is shamelessly hyped as a sort of panacea from every health problem known to man; this is mostly lies, but two things are true: it is tasty, and it's good for skin/hair (I've tried both, and it's true, it works). Don't believe anything else and don't "take" it daily as if it were a medicine: it's pure saturated fat and that's the end of it: it will raise your cholesterol as any other kind of saturated fat. As far as its being a weight-loss agent, this is not a complete lie, but remember, it works only if you _substitute_ CO for other kinds of saturated fats (that means quit eating butter, meat, etc.) If, otoh, you simply _add_ it to your normal diet, you're not gonna lose any weight -- instead, you're gonna gain weight at least as good as you would otherwise + increase your cholesterol. But if you decide to substitute, do not think it's an easy choice: CO is pure saturated fat, whereas other sources of saturated fats (butter, meat, etc.) come with a lot of nutritional goodness like vitamins, proteins, and the like -- things that CO is wholly devoid of. So my suggestion, for what it's worth (not much, I know) is to use CO just as another agreeable food to be used in moderation, not a magic medicine. I read somewhere that a 40-sh male in good health on a 2000 cal/day diet can get 200 calories from saturated fats w/o harming himself.

One other thing I wanted to mention: the jar says it's "pure extra virgin" -- keep in mind that "extra virgin" is meaningful only when applied to olive oil. That is because there are specific and stringent industry standards stipulating what constitutes "virgin", "extra virgin", etc. There are no such standards about any other oils, so saying your CO is "extra virgin" communicates zero useful information and is no more than disingenuous hand-waving. It's like Nutiva says on their jars "no cholesterol!". No kidding, it's like wood-free nails. Of course plant-derived foods have no cholesterol, but BS rules in this industry, so just be aware of what's what and smart enough to dismiss useless hype like claims of a CO being "extra virgin".

OK, there's really no more to say: as long as you use this tasty substance rationally, it's good stuff, so bottomline is: recommended -- except for one thing: just as I was deciding it's time to post a review and navigating to this page, I noticed that the price went up by the mind-blowing 60 percent since, not just since I bought it (two weeks ago), but literally within the last few days. Does my salary go up 60 percent in a couple of days? No. So, while the product is good and I can't give it less than five stars, I will suggest you do not reward naked greed and at least try to find better-priced alternatives. Especially in this economic environment that we have right now. The current price here is even higher than it is in Wegman's (brick-and-mortar grocery store; they carry it, but it's more than the seven bucks I bought it for here).

PS. Btw, I see now someone reports that this oil comes in a glass jar: this is a bare-faced lie. The jar is transparent plastic, quite soft actually, so you can't _honestly_ mistake it for glass. Be extremely suspicious about these massive five-star reviews (here and elsewhere); I for a long time have a feeling those are posted by manufacturers' employees to create hype (and why not? Amazon does nothing to guard against fake reviews; all one needs to do in order to start posting reviews (real OR fake) is buy something once from this site). Some reviews read like the reviewer hasn't actually seen the product in question and is interested only in adding another five-star rating, not the review.

PPS. Thanks to commenters Lulu and Adriana for additional info and helpful suggestions.

I buy and use coconut oil often. I use it to cook with, spread on various foods, take it for my health, use on my skin and hair; kind of a coconut oil junkie. I bought this to try thinking it was better bang for my buck. It works well on my skin and hair but in my humble opinion the taste is terrible. I much prefer the taste of Coconut Pacific 100% Pure Organic Extra Virgin Raw Coconut Oil. I hope Coconut Pacific's Coconut Oil Extra Virgin Organic 14 Oz - Noni Pacific will come back into stock soon as I mainly use Coconut Oil and Olive Oil for day to day cooking.

So, if you are seeking coconut oil for your health where you eat up to a tablespoon a day - do not buy this as you will never get it down.

If you are only looking to use on your hair and skin this should be okay.
THIS OIL LEAVES MY HAIR VERY MOISTERIZED, MY HAIR IS HEALTHIER, I DEEP CONDITION WITH THIS AND SEAL WITH IT AS WELL. THE BEST ON THE PLANET FOR SURE!

I tried this for my hair and skin.  It didn't absorb into either one.  I wore it on my hair for three hours and had to wash my hair three times to get it out.  I had it on my skin for three or four hours also and it never absorbed in, I had to wipe it off.  I didn't see a difference in my hair or skin afterwards either.  Disappointed to say the least.
Are you kidding me?  I can't even begin to list all of the ways I use this amazing coconut oil.  It would be easier to list what it is NOT good for.  Let me think....uh....nothing.

This product is definately YUM.........no, I don't eat it, it just smells so wonderful!

and thoroughly, it is not at all greasy. This is the first product that my extremely
dry cuticles respond to - it leaves them conditioned and my hands very soft. And
FINALLY I have found a product that eliminates the dried skin on my legs! (Ladies,
you know what I'm talking about) I will most definately order this product again
and from this highly recommended seller.
This product smells great, tastes great, and absorbs well. I'd prefer a glass container instead of a plastic one though.

I've had the worst eczema for years. My skin will fall off my pillow and pile up that's how bad it was.

I've tried so many things from lotions, cetaphil, cosmetics, steroid creams, olive oil. All these things made my skin worst. This product immediately soothed my dry skin and didn't feel uncomfortable. I've super-sensitive skin and it didn't irritate me at the slightest and it doesn't have unneccessary ingredients like alcohol which dry and sting your skin.(I just don't understand how products get away with that.)

Also, I heard there's a bunch of antioxidants and apparently it can even help people with aids, my skin looks years younger and I don't feel bizarre anymore whenever people walk my way or make eye-contact with me. I believe if more people knew about this cosmetic companies would run out of business, this is truly a miracle natural product.

Overall, I am very happy with this product.  It smells great.  My only issue was in shipping.  With hot summer weather, the coconut oil turned into a liquid state and leaked out of the sealed container soaking everything else I ordered from amazon.  Thankfully it was nothing I couldn't clean up.  Just keep that in mind when ordering with other items.

Coconut oil is awesome!! I have found the organic coconut oil is even better. It has many uses in my household. I use it on my hair, and skin, and I added it to my smoothies!!! You can go wrong with coconut oil especially this brand!

I have heard wonderful things about coconut oil over the last few years and stumbled upon this one as I was browsing Amazon one day. I have been using it on my feet, as I have very dry heels, and then I put socks on for a little while. It has done very well with moisturizing my feet and making them soft. It's great!

Summary: it so good to my hair
Text: first of all i had dreads for 5 long years be for i spent 5 days taken them out and after i did that my hair was so bad tell i got this and im so in love with my hair and i im black with very course thick hair im really just soooooooooooooo happy to have beautiful long hair

Summary: good price, great for African American hair, curly hair
Text: I bought two of this product since I thought the price was good.  My daughter has African-American hair that is relaxed and dry, so the combo of coconut oil and olive oil (roughly 1/2 tablespoon each), mixed with about 1/4 cup Silk Elements conditioner (from Sally's beauty supply), or any favorite conditioner, really makes a big difference for her dry hair.  Wash out the mixed conditioner, and hair is soft but not oily.  My other daughter has very curly, frizzy hair, and it works well for her hair as well without feeling greasy.

I had been looking for something to help minimize my hair shedding during my transition period from relaxed hair to natural hair.  I have not tried other brands, but after using this brand of coconut oil I'm hooked.  I also used it on my skin and it absorbs well and leaves my skin feeling incredibly soft.  No more lotions full of chemicals for me!!

Summary: Great moisturizer for natural hair (african american)
Text: I recently transitioned from permed to natural hair and use this prodcut to moisturize my teeny weeny afro. I love it and it smells great!

Summary: A health Miracle in a Jar
Text:
I love this stuff. It is delicious. It is solid at room temperature but I prefer it in liquid form which I achieve by running the jar under hot water. I take 1 tbsp about 3-4 times a day and use this as a moisturizer after the shower. It tastes yummy but I did have to get used to the feeling that I was swallowing oil. My hubby had no problem w this and even joked it was so good that he could drink it with a straw. I have suffered w a systemic yeast infection for years which has caused numerous skin problems and a nasty white tongue. This has cleared that up in a week. The pimples I had on my arms and thighs are gone and so are my undereye dark circles. My nails are growing smoothly and my hair stopped falling out when I brush. I also started using it as a vaginal moisturizer and I am extremely pleased with the results. I also noticed how it helped with my cold. My symptoms were mild whereas everyone else had a more severe reaction. It also helped with my cracking feet and my pinky toe, which has been blackened forever, is returning to normal. I love using it on the kids lips because I know when they lick it off it's not harmful. My hubby started taking it as well when he saw how I benefited and he loves the natural burst of energy he gets after. My daughter finally tried some and now loves it on her madelines in the morning. I cant say enough wonderful things about this product. I feel like a brand new person. I wish doctors knew more to recommend this instead of blaming loss of energy and skin problems on aging. This is healthy for you, gives you energy, aids in weight loss and kills bacterias, yeasts and fungus. First magazine just wrote an article on the benefits of adding coconut oil to your diet in their January issue. It's so good that I'm going to subscribe to it.
UPDATE: I still LOVE this product and use it daily. I've found it makes the best pancakes when you grease the griddle w some. It is an excellent wood cleaner and the only way I clean wood, now. I also make a lip scrub w a drop of coconut oil in the palm of my kids' hands and a pinch of sugar. They love how yummy it is, I don't worry if they get it in their mouths, and they no longer have dry, cracking winter lips. My youngest has been using it nightly, after her bath, and the excema that plagues her legs, hasn't returned w the dry, cold air. This has become one of the most used products in my home.

Recently, I wanted to "up the ante" on my Omega fatty acids so I added Coconut oil to go along with my doses of flaxseed oil and fish oil. Yes, Coconut Oil is a saturated fat, but because it's a medium chain tryclyceride (MCT), it's more easily absorbed by the body and converted into energy, not stored on the body as fat. This product has a nice flavor--I use it in cooking and it doesn't depart any heavy "coconut" flavor. Sometimes I just eat a tablespoon. The benefits are tremendous: microbial properties, helps thyroid, liver, pancreas, bones, skin, soothes the digestive tract. The list goes on.

I bought one jar for the kitchen and one jar for my bathroom. This product is great to put on right after a bath or shower. Yes it's a bit greasy at first, but rub it in well and let it absorb, then wipe off the excess with a damp towel or wash cloth. Your skin will be satiny smooth.

Bonus tip: I give a teaspoon to my dog every day. Studies show dogs' prefrontal brains benefit from this wonder fat.

I got this particular oil to combat the damage from a H Pylori stomach infection, as well as get some good fats in me. First of all - this is an incredibly fresh GREAT TASTING product. I can eat spoonfuls of it right out of the jar. (with some chocolate ovaltine - it taste just like 'Almond Joy').  The wide mouth of the jar makes it easy to get to the product without melting it first.  The jar is made of plastic, but you can easily transfer the product to a glass mason jar - if you  want to.

I am a total coconut oil convert. I may even be a zealot. My daughter has very dry type 3C-4A hair, and since I started using the coconut oil on her hair, it has become much more supple and shiny. Less frizz in the mornings, easier to braid and comb, etc. I have thrown out all the traditional mainstream haircare products in favor of this. They don't even compare.

Moreover, I use it as a body/facial moisturizer and it is magnificent. A little goes a long way and my skin stays smooth all day. Love it.

ordered this for face moisturizer as my skin is quite sensitive. I was looking for a natural and inexpensive product and this sounded like a good thing to try. I have been very happy with it. A small bit on my face after showering feels wonderful. I am also trying it on fungused toenails as supposedly it has some antibacterial properties. Too soon to know yet if that works.

Also, it smells heavenly. Love it!
I love this coconut oil.  It is the best makeup remover ever!  Yes, it even removes the waterproof mascara.  It is great for internal and external use.  I can't do without it!

grea t product i have been searching for extra virgin organic coconut oil.And i couldnt find it anywhere.so i went to walmart and bought this bottle of blue magic coconut oil and i was happy.until i read the label,it had petrolatum in it. i harmful chemical that damages the hair and stops it from growing. i was so upset. so i found some organic virgin coconut oil and then decied to order it.i wish it would of costed a litle less but its okay.and guess what you can use this coconut oil in baking as a subsitute for butter,shortening,and margarine.you can also use it on your hair and skin.and you can take it daily for a dietary suplement. great product!

Summary: Anxious to Test Long Term Benefits
Text:
Received my Coconut Oil yesterday, opened immediately for a taste.

1. Pulled off the safety seal and the aroma of fresh coconut wafted out-very pleasant

2. Took a teeny, tiny bit of the "oil" (it's a solid) for a taste. With the aroma, your mind sets you up for MOUNDS...it is NOT. It's very subtle and not at all sweet and it melts on your tongue faster than butter.

3. I toasted a waffle to give it a real test---Most excellent, a hint of coconut and I added a dab of berry preserves....very good. I have a friend who sautees shrimp in it and serves with a mango salsa---now doesn't that sound GOOD!

4. I proceeded to put a small dab on the back of one hand and I do mean SMALL---VERY small...rubbed the BACKS of my hands together to liquify and then distributed over my hands and lower arms. The dab was so small it was almost not "there". My hands were so smooth it was amazing.

More testing to begin on the long term benefits - right now - very happy

** Update - one of the major reasons for purchasing this product are the multitude of health benefits for consuming coconut oil---I just discovered one that is ADDICTIVE.
Keebler makes a new wheatable NutCrisp small cracker: Crunchy Cashew...a little dollop on a cracker and it is absolutely heaven---you can easily get your 3 (recommended) tablespoons a day

Summary: Best thing for diaper rash prevention!
Text: Coconut oil is *fantastic* at preventing and treating diaper rash.  Whenever my daughters bum starts to get a little red, a little dab of coconut oil heals it by the next diaper change.  It works to get rid of diaper rash, too.

Overall, it is a good product because it didn't have a strong taste and I will be purchasing it again.

Last summer we used it as a chemical free sunscreen (SPF 4) and hair conditioner.  We love discovering more and more uses for it!

In the morning I wake up and make 2 scrambled eggs using Coconut Oil. Delish! And my body loves it.

Summary: I feel better and look better
Text: I bought the pint size at first just to try it. Now I am buying the 48 ounce (3 pack). I can not see ever ever ever running out of this stuff. I swear I think my belly fat is melting away. I know I feel better and that is no small thing. The book that got me started was The Coconut Diet, by Cherie Calbom (The Juice Lady) and her husband. Then the benefits of coconut oil are reinforced in Wheat Belly, by William Davis, M.D. I am Southern, so I tried breading okra in almond flour and frying it in coconut oil. Now I am trying to learn to cook with coconut flour too. I am off wheat and dairy completely and don't feel deprived. Can't beat that.

I am in love. Mind you, I only used this oil once and I cannot wait until I deep condition with this overnight. All I did was moisturize my hair before I did my bantu knot outs, and my hair was instantly moisturized. I used my mango butter (Elasta qp) to apply the lotion part, but trust, I didn;t need it. COCONUT OIL IS THE WAY TO GO, esp if you are on a hair journey :-)

Summary: Great Quality; not a good item shipped?
Text: I really enjoy using this product in cooking (popcorn, pancakes, etc) but both shipments I have received have leaked a little. It was strange because the product seemed sealed (I did not find any evidence that it had been opened), but there were clear oil drippings that seeped through the packaging. It was definately coconut oil, as I could tell from the scent. I will no longer get this item shipped. Instead I will buy some at a store.
Fast delivery, and the product is just simply "great". So multipurposeful and easy to use. It's great on skin, great in hair, and great to cook with. It's just, "Simply Great"!

Summary: Amazing stuff!  Cook and bake with this!
Text:
This of course smells wonderfully like coconut, and is smooth and easy to work with. I've used it in brownie batter recently in place of vegetable oil, and they were wonderful and with a slight aroma and taste of coconut...ymumm!

Warning, it cooks eggs fine too, but the slight coconut edge to the scrambled eggs takes a little getting used to.

Although I guess that this might have helped me I am not certain as I also do other exercises which have most definitely benefited me.  The product comes neatly packed and has a nice aroma.  I have been using this for about two months now and although I have heard good things about coconut oil, I have to discuss this with my doctor during my next visit and get lab work done to determine if the use has affected my cholesterol levels.

It is healthy for my heart, makes my food taste great, my skin glow---what else do I want? I bought it here yet I later found it at a vitamin shop for the same price. Recommend it! If possible also purchase The Coconut Oil Miracle book. It has recipes & great info

I don't generally review products, but this works so well for me that I wanted to write about it in hopes someone with the same problem will read this and give coconut oil a try.

For years I've been trying to find some sort of moisturizing lotion, ointment, or oil that would relieve my extremely dry skin. Lotions required constant reapplication, so they were expensive and inconvenient. Ointments were too thick and would make my skin hot and sometimes exacerbate itching. Baby oil didn't seem thick enough. The best solution I found was dissolving a bit of ointment in sesame oil with a dab of steroid ointment to control itching. It was okay, but not great. Plus, I quickly tired of smelling like popcorn.

My dermatologist recommended that I try coconut oil. I've been astonished by how well it works. After only two days of use, my eczema rashes had faded considerably because they longer itched. Patches that I had for months were suddenly gone. The rest of my skin no longer feels dry and tight, which means no new rashes! I only have to apply coconut oil in the morning and after my shower with no need to reapply throughout the day. Best of all, I smell (quite literally) like a fresh coconut right after I apply it, and the scent fades rather quickly (so I don't get sick of it).

I realize this sounds too good to be true, and I'll be sure to update if the product suddenly stops working. But for the time being, I'm absolutely thrilled with the improvement I've seen in my skin!

Ok i have been using this brand of coconut oil for about 3 months now. I have been eating it, and i have hypothyroidism. It has made me feel so much better, more energy, swelling in my throat has gone down and it tastes great! i make chocolate shakes with it. I also use it as a skin lotion, no more dry skin and it smells soo good. I use it on my hair, no more dry hair, it has helped me grow my hair out and its really shiny. I have also been using it on my face, it has completely gotten rid of my acne and is quickly fading my acne scars, and no it does not clog my pores. This coconut oil is amazing, i love it!!!

I don't want to ever be without this coconut oil. I have been using it for quite some time now, and am 69 yrs of age.  I went to see my doctor for my six mths check up,  and she was amazed at my colostrol levels.  She said they were perfect, and wondered what my secret was.  I didn't tell her my secret,  but I do stay away from fatty foods,  and use this cooking oil for frying,  and also baking,  and it gives my food a wonderful flavor.  Tasting this oil alone,  has a delicious coconut taste,  but that same taste doesn't show up in the foods that I use it in, and I don't think one can beat this price anywhere.  I was paying twice as much as this from another company,  plus shipping and handling, but this is a super deal,  no postage,  and half the price.  I just hope Natures Way will never stop having this coconut oil available, I also like the fact that it is organic.  I will continue ordering this oil as long as it is available.

In regards to the supplement, it does in fact suppress your appetite, which will than lead to smaller portion control if you were ever to stop using this as a supplement.

My next step would be to use it for a replacement of cooking oil but hopefully the meat won't have that taste of coconut...I love coconut but not to that extent.

This Coconut Oil is super good, so good I have it on auto order. It is organic, tastes great, smells great, very fresh, ships fast..I love it. I use it in place of butter or margarine on my food, I use it to stir fry, I also use it on my face. I am a vegetarian and would recommend it to others. One of my favorite dishes is baked sweet potato, I cut a large one in half after baking and put Natures Way coconut oil, cinnamon, and pecan pieces on top. Everyone that eats one of these says "I taste fresh coconut on this, how did you do that?". I don't mean to rant but this product is something to rant about! Just try it, you will like it.

This brand absorbs into the skin a lot faster, without leaving the oily film on top of the skin, so I will continue to use this coconut oil for skin and hair care.

this organic coconut oil is very white and delicious...it is not pale like some coconut oil i have purchased in the past...they looked oily sort of ..this is a very good grade of coconut oil.i use it in my manna balls recipe...it is good for rubbing into your hands to soften them and lubricate them it smells wonderful...and taste delicious...it is liquid at room temperture and solid at room temperture according to the temp of your room it is in...a good buy  16 oz jar bought on amazon.com

Summary: The many uses of coconut oil...
Text: I purchased this item about a month ago. I wanted to wait until I had an opportunity to really use the product in many ways and to gauge the results.  I started out taking tablespoon as soon as I purchased it...and soon discovered that other reviewers are correct - some people have to work their way up to taking a tablespoon. Now I take a table spoon in the morning mixed with a protein shake. Sometimes, I mix it in hot coffee or tea. I have also started taking an additional tablespoon in the afternoon either spread on crackers or a small piece of bread.  As a food, it gives me an extra boost of energy and seems to make me more alert.  I have begun to lose weight but I am not certain if this is because of the coconut oil or because I have implemented a walking routine. Either way, it gave me the energy to want to get up and get moving! I also use it as a moisturizer on my skin. It does go on rather oily, but it absorbs quickly. I just have to make certain that I give myself enough time for the oil to absorb before putting on certain fabrics. I was in awe regarding how soft my skin felt. Rough patches are now smooth.  I have stopped using a popular African American hair moisturizer on my son's hair and began using this.  All I can say is his hair loves coconut oil. It improved his texture.  I have also used it on an area of his head that seemed prone to razor bumps.  It is healing well. Finally, I read that this is safe for dogs.  I gave some to my dog and now he demands it each morning. He loves it too.
This stuff is awesom!! I use it on my hair and as a body moisterizer ,leaves my skin soft and my hair shiny .  i will be ordering some more very soon :)

This oil smells like fresh coconut, which is what a good-quality coconut oil should smell like. It had a few pieces of real coconut floating at the bottom, which actually made it feel much more "authentic" to me. Interestingly enough, it arrived in liquid form (it's hot here) and I slathered it on my elbows right away. It worked great! Softened and smoothed them and got rid of that leathery feel. Can't wait to use it as a full-body moisturizer after a shower (just not on the face--never put coconut oil on the face if you don't like clogged pores).
I have bought several brands of coconut oil, but this one is Pure, has an excellent taste.  Coconut Oil has a million uses.  Don't hesitate to buy this product.

Summary: Nutiva fan now in love with Nature's Way!
Text: When buying coconut oil, I often research every option possible and compare the price per ounce.  I make and sell granola and need to get the best price possible without sacrificing quality.  I decided to try a jar of this, because it was the lowest price, yet still organic and extra virgin.  I am so glad I did!  I actually prefer it, because it stays liquid until you open it.  In order to use coconut oil in my granola, I have to melt it first.  This brand, I did not have to melt first, only if I used some from an already-opened jar.  So it is just fine with me, actually better, that it comes in small jars. I ordered quite a lot more after trying it, afraid the price would go up after all the EVCO fans caught on to the deal.  Thanks, Nature's Way, I love it!!!
If you are looking for an oil that is paleo friendly and tastes great this is it. Tastes great cooking with this as well as making popcorn with it. Great product.

This is my first coconut oil buy and I am so glad I did! I bought it for external use, and I love love love rubbing in on my skin and how it feels afterwards. It smells great and I can't wait to use it in my body butter recipes. I've not used it for cooking yet, but I am intrigued at the thought.

It cured my dry, itchy, bumpy skin (arms & legs) by second day - just use it like lotion after shower while skin is still moist/damp (I used loofah scrub first). My skin feels like baby skin and itching is gone. It really smells nice after soaking into your skin, which happens pretty quickly, and greasiness is gone - I can't stop smelling my arms.

Also use this in cooking a lot. It was great with banana bread - just substitute 1/4 to 1/2 of melted butter called for in the recipe (don't substitute all the butter, I believe the bread will be drier if you just use coconut oil). As a kid, we used pure coconut oil as hair conditioner in my hometown. So tonight, I will use it on my heels because they are always dry since I wear sandals a lot. I bought this in Amazon a while back and it was very cheap compared to WholeFoods price.

This is my first time purchasing coconut oil, and I have no prior experience with it.  It is white and in solid form, but easily liquifies in the palm of your hands, and it has a light and very pleasant coconut smell to it.  It tastes good (a light coconut flavor), but I use this product mainly for my hair, nails and skin.  It makes my skin soft, and my nails and hair are subjectively stronger and healthier looking.

OMG!! I love,love,love this coconut oil. I use this for my hair and skin. I even used this for athlete's feet, this amazing oil cleared up my athlete's foot in one day. I will be using this for the rest of my life and i highly recommend it. I am also going to try it as a food supplement.
i love this coconut oil its smells nice and is a great conditioner. wonderful product and consistency is very good.
I use coconut oil for just about all my oil needs.  I love it.  Received this order in just a few days from Amazon.  Will no doubt buy it again.
Got this in the mail last week. It exceeded my expectations. Smells great, feels great. So many uses. For organic the price and quality can't be beat. I highly recommend.
I love this product. I am already almost out of it and need to order more. Shipping was fast. Thank you

I Love It I Want To Say I Recieved Coconut Oil And  With In Two Days I Felt More Energy I was Not Tired.I Use Coconut Oil For My Cracker, Put It On  My Food Dish  To Cook With It.I Am Please With It And Happy What I Have Purchase.

taste i would say is mediocre but this item is a good value on Amazon.unbelievably fast shipping-arrived in MA from NJ in less than 48 hrs after placing order. ordered on sunday night, received on tuesday afternoon...wow...product as described, packaged well, great price and only $.99 shipping cost. The Vitamin Shoppe via Amazon - Highly recommended. The other coconut oil I would recommend is: Nutiva Organic Coconut Oil, 29-Ounce Jars (Pack of 2)

I put it in the refrigerator but it got way too hard. I love the potential, but not sure it's really going to work for me. For now, I've been spooning it on my pancakes and bagels, and it tastes just fine. Hopefully, it'll act a little more like butter in a couple of months when the house cools down to around 70 degrees.
I really like this product.  I sometimes eat it spread on an English muffin and I have cooked with it.  It has a light coconut taste.  Very, very good! I will buy it again.

I quit using lotion on my face and switched to this. I now rarely ever break out. I love in az so this is great for an all over moisturizer.  Smells yummy too!  This is a great product with a great price.

Oh, and I've also gargled with it! I am excited to find many uses for this yummy stuff! I'll post an update about how it well it works when I've used it more.

This product was just okay. i expected something great with all the hype and positive reviews. Most of the jar is still in my cupboard it is nothing more special than the cheaper brands that i use. I mainly used it in my skin and hair. I will now give it to my dog for her good health.

Summary: Stained bedsheets, but overall good for face/neck area
Text:
I was very excited when I had read all the reviews, and so far no negative comments.
I experienced a slight break out , but nothing to worry out, as many others stated, definitely sticking with it. As it feels very smooth on your face.
Just try out how much to use, not more then half of a small nail size for sure, otherwise it will be to oily.
I was reluctant to try tasting it, but it really tasts very good, unless you hate coconut.
Will definitely try it for cooking as I have two different containers.

When I had a small acne breakout, and one of those undercover pimples that threaten to come out and stay around for days it was gone in 3-4 days and never surfaced. So so far very good. Will keep using it and update accordingly.

Only thing I want to caution everyone, after showering I decided to use it as all over body oil, I recall rubbing it in , but obviously not good enough , as I did go to bed an hour or so later, and the next morning I noticed dark grey stained spots on the bedsheet, I tried to wash them and use stain remover but no luck, I also saw there were some stains on the bathrope. So just be cautiouse when you apply it, how much etc.

I ORIGINALLY ORDERED THIS TO MOISTURIZE MY HAIR. IT REALLY IS NOT AS GREASY AS PEOPLE WOULD THINK. WHEN YOU FIRST APPLY IT YES IT DOES FEEL GREASY, BUT IT ABSORBED LIKE A LOTION DOES! MY SKIN IS SO SOFT RIGHT NOW, AND NOT OILY. I DID PUT SOME ON MY FACE FOR THE FIRST TIME, I WILL DO AN UPDATE TO LET YOU KNOW IF IT MAKES ME BREAK OUT!

I bought this product while searching for organic coconut oil for my hair. The price was great for this size compared to others. It works very well in my hair. It's a wonderful daily moisterizer. I am not a fan of it on my skin...for my skin I prefer sweet almond oil. I have also used it in desserts. Pretty flavorful. I'd recommend it.

Summary: Just what I was looking for in coconut oil!
Text: I've been having trouble finding affordable coconut oil in my area, and so I ordered Nature's Way, based on the reviews and price. I love the product and I got a good deal on the price due to subscribing to it. Highly recommend.
love the oil. but i hate the jar, whenever i try to pour out some of the oil it spills every where. for this reason going 2 try another brand next time.

This is the first time I've tried any coconut oil, so I don't have anything to compare it to, but I really, really like this stuff. It lives up to all the hype, and I assume it's as good for me as everyone says. It's solid at room temperature, easy to scoop and spread, and has a great, mild flavor. I've tasted it plain, added it to smoothies, spread it on bread, and used it in place of butter for cookies. Very versatile.

Summary: Better than I thought it would be
Text: I was skeptical of the difference in all natural organic and the stuff you get from a regular grocery store.  I bought other coconut oil mostly due to the fact that it was the same price as olive oil and I thought it was "all natural" as it basically stated it on the container.  After reading reviews of the other stuff I bought not being organic I decided to give this a try.  While this is definitely pricier, the difference is astounding!  If you like the taste of coconuts, this is the bomb.  The other tasted nothing like coconuts, or really anything at all, so when I opened the container of this I was quite intrigued.  I put this on vegetables and when I cook fish and it definitely helps with the vegetables since I have to generally force myself to eat them.  With that said, I don't think I would buy this product again simply due to price.  I would go to another brand assuming they are as good since you can buy much more for only a little bit more in cost.  This changed my whole view toward organic, and hopefully makes me healthier.  If you read this review look at all the stuff they put in processed food ... specifically benzene!  I work in chemical plants, so I know how terrible this stuff is, and the fact they use it in food processing blows my mind!  Also, the fact that they don't have to tell you is even crazier.  There is no way this type of stuff doesn't harm you!
Not much to say but, this is good stuff,EFAGold Coconut Oil, Extra Virgin, Organic, 16 oz. for a good price.

I ordered this thinking it would come in a glass jar.  I was disappointed to see that it comes in a plastic container.  It is labeled as recycling #1 (PETE), which from what I have read can leach phthalates when left in the heat (which is was, since the package was left on the porch in the sun and who knows where it was before that).  I don't like to take my chances with chemicals leaching into a product that I want to put on my skin and in my food.  I tried to return it but surprisingly (and happily), Amazon refunded the money without requiring me to send this back. WOW!  Way to go Amazon for customer service.  I just think the description of the product should specify that it comes in a plastic container.

Summary: Good until it comes back up!
Text: I loved this product when I initially received it.  I purchased it to use as a dietary supplement and was pleased to discover that it works wonders on hair and skin as well.  I read the label carefully because I was concerned about whether or not to refrigerate.  The label clearly said that refrigeration was not required.  However, after appx. 2 weeks of using as a daily dietary supplement, I began to notice an awful cramping, nauseous feeling not long after I took it.  It was the sickest I have ever felt in my entire life and I repeated it just to be sure that it was the coconut oil causing it and not something else I had eaten.  Same thing again.  All I can figure is the oil went rancid.  There's no other explanation for why it suddenly started causing me to be sick.  So, word to the wise, consider refrigerating this product.  I've stopped using it altogether because I now associate the smell of it with sickness. :(

Summary: Alive, Ageless, Gourmet and Gathering Years... meaning the oil!]
Text:
Length:: 9:15 Mins

Some say the COCONUT palm is the Tree of Life. They say Life is honored and perpetuated through its meat, its water, its oil, its presence.

In my opinion, EVAGold, and the Nutiva brand of coconut oil shown in the video, are among the highest qualities available, of life healing offerings from this sacred gift of a tree. I had sensed this cold pressed oil's uncanny value as soon as I saw a picture of a jar of EVAGold on Swanson's product list on Amazon. I had come to trust Swanson [as much as I continue to trust Amazon] from purchases of several types of magnesium supplements including Magnesium Oil 8 fl oz Spray.

Reading Bruce Fife's The COCONUT OIL MIRACLE, provided necessary information for working with this fruit. Reading that book also clarified my previous belief in the healing nutrition in coconut oil, and in these brands' production purity [other excellent brands are also available; these two are just the ones I've used successfully so far]. My experience of using this type of cold pressed, virgin coconut oil for only 24 hours had shown results which made me feel blessed!

I've been slowly and steadily rectifying a serious magnesium deficiency while searching for what felt like a missing catalyst or synergistic essence which would cause magnesium supplementation to be accepted by the body, and then seated into the cellular level of life enhancing operations. Dr. Carolyn Dean's book, The MAGNESIUM MIRACLE is an excellent guide to Magnesium's magic in healing, normalizing, and strengthening the embodied human soul. I've been thinking that coconut, in its several forms of use, could work as a catalyst for magnesium, while magnesium works as a catalyst for all other nutrients, including coconut oil, to function correctly. What a team!!

To understand the vital message in what I'm trying to say here, please be cajoled or even coerced (jokingly) into reading some of my Amazon.com reviews on magnesium products and the two books linked above... as a start on a journey to understanding, appreciating, and relishing LIFE. Other great Magnesium and Coconut books and products are available, easily found using search capacities.

According to some experts, the most important thing to know about oils, fats, and coconut products is that they should be gently, minimally, and carefully processed by cold pressing, preferably labeled ANH (absolutely no heat used in processing); the reasons for this are detailed in Fife's book.

Also according to some experts, the most important thing to know about magnesium is that it needs to be held in highest priority and percentage in the minerals taken into the body, and that certain foods, additives, and supplements can defeat bio-availability of magnesium. Especially calcium needs to be taken in much lower amounts than magnesium, and in the current food marketplace and general eating habits; calcium is usually assimilated in large quantities, causing illnesses related to calcification or deposits, and contributing to magnesium deficiency. This situation is detailed in Dr. Dean's book.

My main concern with coconut usage for persons like me who are severely deficient in magnesium is that most offerings of coconut I'm aware of hold more potassium than magnesium, which could upset the balance and primary necessity of magnesium.

In my non-professional opinion magnesium is the INDEX nutritional substance; the A-Priori for Life.

Maybe even the Tree of Life needs magnesium as its priority nutrient...

With adequate magnesium held within the cell structures... [some experts say cells need to retain 10,000 times more magnesium than any other mineral]... the body can adequately and correctly utilize other minerals and necessary nutrients, in order to live strong and disease free. [See my review of Dr. Dean's book.]

Maybe magnesium seats life, coconut is the cozy catalyst, and taste buds rule!

Linda Shelnutt

Other excellent coconut oils available on Amazon:

Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 54-Ounce Jar
[The link above goes to the large size, the one I showed in my review on Bruce Fife's book]

Nutiva Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 15-Ounce Tubs (Pack of 2) [This is the product used in the video here. Though the flavor and quality of the EFAGold was slightly better, of the bottles I've used so far, I will happily and thankfully continue to purchase all three of these products, for various reasons favoring each.]

Really was surprised about the taste!Not what I was expecting.There may be others even better,and I will try them all.But as usual.....any thing that's good for you is expensive,That's why poor people will never be healthy.

Summary: I don't eat it, but I love it for my skin and hair!
Text:
People usually use coconut oil for food consumption, but I don't because I eat low-fat and get what I need by consuming small amounts of whole nuts, seeds or avocado. Oil is not a whole food and is pure saturated fat. You may want to debate me on this, but I am not open to change my view (I have studied up on this and know I feel much better and have more energy without loading up on lots of fat and protein).

I prefer to use this oil for my hair and as a moisturizer for my body. It has a great smell (I think about the coconut butter people use when they go to the beach) and it is certified organic. It make my hair and skin feel soft and silky and lasts a long time, as I have the same container for almost a year.

Summary: It would have been 5 stars but a whole section of the coconut oil was missing from the jar
Text: I never write reviews, because I have not had any complaints on any of my products that I have purchased through Amazon.  I understand that its not just about bad reviews but good ones too, but for me the product is always great unless I am writing a review.  Thus here I am writing a review today.  I must state that if the coconut oil had not been missing an entire section of coconut oil from the right side of the jar, I would be giving this product 5 stars.  I love the taste, quality, shipping time etc., but the missing oil in the right side of the jar (the oil is solid) shocked the heck out of me.  I would have written something earlier about this, but I just haven't had the time.  Every time I look in the jar though, it still shocks me.  I wondered if it was due to the way the product was packaged.  Maybe it rolled onto its side and caused the top to be more full and the right side to be empty, however, it wasn't full to the top.  Also it's solid and I didn't order it during the warm months for it to be liquid and change.  So, yes, I feel ripped off.  However, I'm using the coconut oil because I do need it and already have it in my possession.  I will not be buying my now bi-monthly supply again through this dealer though, unless they decide to make this right.
This is exactly what I was looking for and it is exactly what was described in the listing info so I am very pleased and would recommend this product to others.

Summary: Wish I had Found This a Long Time Ago!

Massage this into your skin after a hot shower or before bed for great results. It also works great as a hair moisturizer and I even use it for hot oil treatment. My only advice is that you find some kind of bottle to put it in or mix it into your favorite lotion. I rinsed out an empty shampoo bottle. I find that at room temperature, constantly dipping your hand in gets kind of messy. I love it!

When the first time I triad this coconut oil, I love it. I use it in my hair and now is much moisturizer, shiny and less shell than ever. Totally until now, I ordered 4 of this products. Highly highly recommended

Summary: I first got this for baby's eczema...
Text:
I was looking for natural moisturizers that alleviate symptoms of eczema and I came across this coconut oil. No, it is not a cure but it is a good moisturizer to use on a baby with eczema, espeically for the face since my baby sucks on his hands, rubs it all over his cheeks and then takes it right back into his mouth.

Actually, I read that eating just 3 tsps a day, the lauric acid content in breastmilk jumps up from 3% to 9%. As far as the results, I don't know if the coconut oil through my breastmimlk helped him but I sure got hooked! I love the taste, texture, and look forward to taking my suuplemental tlbs. I plan to bake with it this weekend and have asked my husband to use it for cooking as well. I've rubbed some on my hands and face and it feels really soft and well moisturized. I haven't tried it in my hair yet but plan too. When I told my coworkers about my new obsession, they seemed a bit confused but really, read about the countless benefits and see how easy it is to substitue coconut oil for so many of your daily care and food. I'm ordering the 54oz tub from a different brand from amazon today.

Not sure if its because its a healthy type of fat.But anyway I absolutely love, love , love this product.

however with the acne part, its not for everyone. I'm fortunate enough that this work wonderfully for me. But it wouldn't hurt to try. Its affordable and no harsh chemicals added at all.

This coconut oil is sweet & delicious. I eat it straight out of the jar, use it as lotion, use it on my hair & I even put it on my dogs. They have skin issues & applying the oil topically as well as feeding it to them healed their skin in a matter of days. Using it on my face instead of lotion is clearing my combination skin up. It's like a miracle oil. Highly recommend it.

Summary: Delicious and Fresh, no complaints in regards to the product quality...BUT
Text:
I love this coconut oil, I ordered 4 quantities and all of them were super fresh and tasted very delicious. The texture was great and it's a joyous treat to use every time. Coconut oil has many uses, but I use it mainly as a dietary supplement. I use it to cook my morning eggs or sauteing vegetables with the omelet, add some to my oatmeal every morning, put a little in my tea or coffee, add some to my protein or fruit shakes, or just take it by the spoonful which is melt in your mouth deliciousness.
I am a very active person and a health nut, and I follow a low-carb diet and way of life, so I put great emphasis on consuming lots of quality oils and fats in my diet. Coconut oil makes the perfect addition. I am 100% satisfied with the quality of this coconut oil.

However, having said all of this, one thing that I wish was different about the product was the package. The jar is plastic and my limited knowledge in chemistry points me to the old knowledge that "like dissolves like"... and since oils and plastics are both derived from nonpolar substances, this leads me to worry that there will be plastic leaking into the oil. Albeit this is a tremendously slow process, nonetheless it still makes me second guess coming back to this product and purchasing a brand that uses glass jars instead. If they change their packaging methods, I will have no problem purchasing this brand again. Although, I did not take off any stars for this reason because most coconut oil packages these days seem to come in plastic containers, so it wouldn't be fair to rate this brand less than others.

One thing that I have done to lessen my worry is to refrigerate the oil so that it solidifies. My rationale behind this is that less oil is in contact with the plastic container when the oil is solidified because only the edges touch as opposed to a liquid form, which is constantly mixing and makes more surface area contact. I actually like to take my coconut oil when solidified because I like how it melts slowly when eaten and you can savor the taste better.

I hope this helped others.

I started using this product as a dietary supplement which boost your energy and also helps me feel fuller faster, the taste isn't bad, its just really oily. Also I love it as a conditioner, I put it in my hair overnight or sometimes for 3hours and the next morning when I wash my hair its so managable,bouncy and defines my natural curls, I am african-american and this works great on my hair especially cause my hair is really thick, also I use on my skin(face) and it make my face feel nice and smooth it gives that natural glow. I really like how fast I recieved my product and was able to keep track of it, also the sender responded in a timely manner when I emailed them so they can take the hold off, so i can pick it up at my local ups store

Summary: One of my New Kitchen Staples
Text:
There was a time when I went out of my way to avoid coconut oil - I'm not quite sure if I was confusing it with palm oil, or if medical science was actually lumping it together with all the other saturated fats as a dietary NO-NO. Of course that's all changed now, and coconut oil is recognized as one of the 'good' oils - but it was still only recently that I had a chance to try it for myself. Wow! It's great stuff.

Coconut oil has a unique quality in that it has a melting point of 76 degrees, F - and out here where I live (Oregon), that means I seldom see it as a liquid oil (even in summer) - but that's fine with me, for one of the things I like using it for is in biscuits and pie crust, and for those, it has to be solid - and as a solid fat, coconut oil is quite hard (really hard!), even when close to 75 degrees - and for that reason, it is much better for use in baking, where a hard fat works much better than a soft one.

But another characteristic of coconut oil that I love is its flavor and aroma - when you open the jar and stick your nose down in it, you are enveloped in the beauty of the coconut's best element, its aroma - its almost frightening how beautiful that smell is. Maybe it's just me, but that aroma literally sends me to the tropics each time I open the jar.

And then there's the flavor. Most fats have little or no flavor - in fact, as cooks we've been taught to use a fat with no flavor in our cooking. However, we all know that many fats are flavor! And if we remove the fat, we lose much of the flavor. Well friends, coconut oil is a fat with super flavor! Anything you make with it will have the subtle flavor of the topics - I use it when I make rice, when I do S E Asian dishes and curries, and to make great scrambled eggs.
